texts.en: Adelaida S. is a 55-year-old hardworking and ever supportive mother for her five children who range in age from 11 to 24 years old and her husband who is a farmer. Having been living under the umbrella of poverty since birth until she has her own family, Adelaida believed that her patience and industry in running a business through the opportunity to access credit will change the lives of her children. Therefore, in 2009 Adelaida joined ASHI and used the loan she had received to raise hog/pig. After four months of raising or fattening, pig will be sold either alive or slaughtered for its meat to be sold per kilo. Out of her loan then, she was able also to support her husband’s fishing business. The thought of her five children especially those three who were elementary and high school undergraduate in addition to her youngest two who were still studying in elementary and high school, gives her courage to request for a larger amount of loan and be willing to take risk in growing a business. Adelaida said that without her loan, supporting the financial requirement of her business to expand and increase the profit would be impossible. For her this means that her dream for her children to graduate from college and for their lives to be changed would mean nothing.

loans.use: Will be used as a payment for purchasing piglets for fattening and sacks of rice for selling

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth B. is from the village of Lodiong Tambulig,Zamboanga del Sur. She is 35 years old. Ruth is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a "sari-sari" retail store selling daily use products and dried goods in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ruth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees and save as a reserve for future needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn T. requests a loan of PHP7,000 for her vegetable vending business. She has been involved in the retail business for three years and with the help of lenders, she is making it more profitable. She hopes that her business will continuously be supported by lenders because it is the only source of income she has. As much as possible, she would still like to lend some help to her children because it makes her happy to share them with what she has.

Marilyn is a very generous mother to her four children. She wasn’t able to send her children to college, but somehow she was able to send them all to secondary school and is happy they graduated. They now have their own families and some of them have their own source of income already. Marilyn and her husband live together in the village of Minallo, Naguilian, Isabela.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for her vending business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie F. wanted to strengthen the business she started and has been supporting through her loan in ASHI since her membership in 2008. With the larger amount of loan she is requesting right now, she will buy a motorized fishing boat and fishing gears for her husband to be able to fish more and to be able to fish in deeper parts of the ocean. For her own business, a small portion from her loan will be spent for growing her hogs/pigs.

The proceeds Elsie will be getting from her business will be used for repairing their house until such time wherein she can afford to rebuild a stronger and more concrete house to shelter her six children who range in age from two to 21 years old.  Elsie is also hopeful that despite the very poor economic condition her family is having right now, through her business and the assistance of loans she can request through ASHI, even one if not all of her children will graduate from college and their lives will be changed.

loans.use: To buy a motorized fishing boat and fishing gears for her husband  and fsupplies or her hog-raising business

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is already thirty-eight years old and is happily married to Nel, who is forty years old. They are engaged in cultivating their own farm located in their village. They are blessed with three children: Violeta, their eldest, is now twenty-two years old and has just finished high school; next to her is Russel, thirteen, currently a third year high school student; and Rochelle, nine, is also studying and she is now a grade three student. Their family lives in the village of Minallo, Naguilian, Isabela. Amelia has been involved in a hog raising business for three years already. Aside from this, she is also engaged in the retailing of rice, fruits and vegetables in their village, which is her daily source of income. She wants to further expand her business and she needs additional working capital to do so.

She hopes that lenders will again give her the chance to maintain and expand her business. She hopes to obtain a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 for the development of her livestock and retail business.

loans.use: Buy more livestock feed and farm supplies

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia M. is 47 years old and she lives in Sta. Cruz, San Manuel, Isabela. She is married to Alex M., who is 59 years old. Their main source of income is farming with their products being corn and vegetables. Adelia retails a variety of goods in her general store as her daily source of income.

Through her business she gained profit and it will allow them to finance their children's education. Their eldest have almost graduated with degrees and now have their own jobs, but the youngest is still in college and taking an Information Technology course.

Adelia wanted to assist the studies of her youngest son with his degree course, so she will do her best on her part to make their dreams come true. Her business helps her in providing their financial needs in sending her children to school through her profit.

She wanted to expand her store in order to have higher profit that will allow her to finance the needs of her son in pursuing his education. She requested the amount of Php 40,000 for the expansion of her store business.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is requesting a loan of PHP4,000 from KIVA lenders to have additional capital for her livestock business (pig raising). She is planning to purchase an added number of piglets to grow her business and also to buy a stock of feed for the livestock's food needs. She lacks the capital now thus she is hoping for lenders to give her financial assistance. The loan she is asking for will be a big help and help her business grow. She hopes that she will be given the chance to grow her business so she can provide for the education of her youngest child. She hope to give him a bright future and she believes her business will be of great help.

Avelina is now 51 years old. She lives in the rural village of Sta. Isabela Norte Ilagan, Isabela with her family. They live there simply. Their major source of income is through the farm that was formerly managed by her husband who had passed away. Four of her eldest children are already living independently. Avelina is hoping that through her requested loan, she will be able to uplift her family's current poor living condition

loans.use: Purchase more piglets

loans.name: Nao

texts.en: Nao N., 51, is a hard working woman, and currently works as a professional silk weaver. She has six married and four single children, while her husband is a construction worker. Nao N. requests a loan in order to support her current investment. She will buy more materials to continue weaving.

loans.use: To buy more materials to continue weaving

loans.name: Manuelita

texts.en: Manuelita T. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Manuelita is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Manuelita owns a business operating a transportation service. The main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport services. Manuelita has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Manuelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manuelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Manuelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia tiene 44 años, es una mujer muy luchadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia, y lo que más desea es tener una vida mejor. El negocio de Aurelia es la carpintería, en su pequeño taller construye diversas cosas como muebles, roperos, camas, puertas, sillas, etc, los cuales luego pone a la venta en su propia carpintería o los lleva a vender a las ferias dominicales, pero también realiza trabajos a pedido los cuales cumple muy puntualmente.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es darle los últimos retoques a sus artículos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar con las maquinarias pesadas que usa para moldear la madera. Para el futuro, anhela que su negocio crezca y le genere mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Aurelia con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con los pagos de todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más madera para poder cumplir con los nuevos pedidos que le han llegado.

loans.use: Compra de madera

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en: Kuch C., 49, is a widow and resides with three of her children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who is able to make less than US$1 every day. Besides this business, she also sells chickens at the local market to have an additional income to raise the standard of living. She is also aided by her children who are garment factories workers. Kuch C. is asking for a loan of US$550 she needs to purchase more chickens to sell at the market.

loans.use: Sell chickens.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
“Behind the clouds, the sun is still shining”, says Rowena as she sees hope behind all hardships in life that her family experiencing nowadays. Rowena is 29 years old and she is already married but she has no children yet. Having a big family is what she dreams for. So far, the couple is focused in improving their businesses for the preparation of their future children. The couple lives in the village of La Salette, Benito Soliven, Isabela. 
	Rowena is engaged in hog raising business in their village.  The profit they earned from vending grown-up hogs made it possible for her to build her new variety store which she now manages.  Her husband is in full support with her businesses and they hope that they will be able to further expand their business.
	Rowena is requesting to obtain a loan of PHP5,000 for the growth of her businesses. This amount will be of big benefit especially to her general store which is starting to grow. She hopes that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: additional capital for the growth of her business

loans.name: Peng

texts.en: Peng P., 45, is a professional decorates handicrafts living at home in the Takeo province. Since 2005, she has been using beads and other materials to make flower on woman clothes to earn a living and typically making US$3 each day. Decorates dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wears it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and its price is expensive too. Most of the people prefer hand made than machine made. She said she knows how to decorate from her mother and she has started doing that business since she was not married yet. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver who is able to make a living of US$5 each day. This couple has four children, three of them are employed and one is in school. Peng P. would like a loan of US$700 her husband needs to replace an old and unreliable moto.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike.

loans.name: Luzel

texts.en:
Luzel T. is from the village of Poblacion Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 37 years old. Luzel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Luzel owns & operates a "calenderia," a mini restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers, and different products to sell in the local community. Luzel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Luzel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to expand the business. Luzel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase foods & drinks for the mini restaurant. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Luzel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food & drinks for the mini restaurant

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, 32 years old, is married to Efren C., who works as a seaman abroad. She was also an OFW/DH (overseas factory worker/domestic helper) in Singapore in 2003. They have one son named Mark Steven, who is three years old. She's living with her son in San Francisco, Cauayan City, a semi-urban area where people have their own ideologies in handling their business.

She is a franchiser and has been dealing AVON & MSE products (cosmetics, apparel, shoes, bags) for almost 5 years now. Her monthly net income is 2,500 PHP. She plans to use a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP for her additional needs. She plans this month to purchase another order for 5,000 PHP, to increase her income. She wants to improve her business and plans to have a retail store next year if she has enough capital.

loans.use: To purchase more goods (cosmetics, apparel) for direct selling

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yet

texts.en: Yet S. is 50-year-old and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital. To make a living, Yet S. always orders traditional silk skirts in bulk from weavers who live near her house and then bring those skirts to sell in retail from home to home around her community. She sells her item to people who need to wear for parties or other ceremonies. In the business, her husband (pictured) helps work with her in ordering and selling produces. This older couple has five children: three are single and two are married and have ready started new homes. Yet S. needs extra capital in order to make her business successful. She requested a loan of US$1000 to be used to purchase traditional silk skirt to sell.

loans.use: To purchase traditional silk skirt to sell

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov K. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and her young child in the TaK. province. Since 2007, she has been selling rice to earn a living and is able to make about $10 USD in revenue, while her husband is a seller. He sells mosquito nets, pillows, mats, and other housing materials. This business allows him to make a significant $13 USD each day. To earn more money, Pov K. decided to borrow a loan of $1,000 USD from Kiva via CREDIT MIF. Her husband needs to purchase more mosquito nets, pillows, and mats to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase mosquito nets, pillows, and mats to sell

loans.name: Rosefemar

texts.en:
Rosefemar, 29 years old, is married to Franklin D. C.. She is blessed with a son named Red Mar Francis, who is five years old. Her husband is an OFW, or Overseas Factory Worker. Rosefemar stands in as father and mother to her son, due to the absence of her husband.

Rosefemar manages a grocery store and veterinary-product store in the village of Mapalad San Agustin. According to her, the business she’s managing is improving, but she still needs to continue what she has started. In this regard, she is requesting additional capital amounting 50,000 PHP, which will be utilized for business improvement. Rosefemar hopes that she will be able to get the loan amount that she is requesting to be able to purchase more items for her store.

Rosefemar says that “Through patience and humility you can attain success in life.” She also prays that God will continue to guide her in managing her grocery store for her family's needs. Her first business focused only on veterinary products, but nowadays she has another kind of business, which is a grocery store. Through the income she generates in her business, and the support given by her husband, she has been able to put up her grocery store. She hopes that her business will expand.

loans.use: Additional capital for purchasing more items for her store

loans.name: Fiorella

texts.es:
Fiorella tiene 19 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para salir adelante en la vida. El negocio de Fiorella es la venta de películas, canciones, documentales, dibujos animados, etc, en formato DVD, ella aprovecha todas las ferias de las zonas cercanas a la ciudad de Juliaca para vender su producto, ya que sabe que existe una gran demanda y que de esta forma puede abarcar un mercado más grande.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede decidir cuándo trabaja y cuándo no, ya que también tiene que cumplir con sus estudios. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que viajar llevando su caja de DVDs a las distintas ferias. Para más adelante desea tener una tienda de videos con la cual obtenga mejores ingresos económicos.	

Este es el segundo préstamo de Fiorella con MFP y está dispuesta a pagarlo puntualmente, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde participa activamente. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más DVDs para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Fiorella is 19 years old and a hardworking and cheerful young woman. She lives at home with her parents and is predisposed to working hard as a means of getting ahead. Fiorella sells movies, concerts, documentaries, cartoons, and other forms of entertainment on DVD. She brings her merchandise to all the local fairs near the city of Juliaca for sale to customers. She knows there is great demand and is capable of covering a larger market.

What Fiorella enjoys most about her job is the ability to decide when and when not to work because she also has to complete her studies. She has been in business for 2 years and the most difficult part is having to travel and carry her box of DVDs to the different fairs. In the future, she would like to open a video store so that she can generate better earnings.

This is Fiorella’s second loan with MFP. She is willing to make her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank, where she is an active participant. With her loan of 2500 soles, she will buy more DVDs so that she can offer her customers a greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of DVDs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget A. is 27 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She and her husband are sellers who are able to make a living of about $10 USD in revenue. Both of them sell mats, pillows, mosquito nets, and other home materials. They have been engaged in this business since 2005. This couple has two young children. Nget A. would like to take out a loan of $1,200 USD to purchase more mosquito nets, pillows, and other things to sell at the market.

loans.use: Home product sales

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia tiene 53 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. El negocio de venta de zapatos y zapatillas de Florencia está ubicado en la mina La Rinconada (Provincia de San Antonio de Putina, distrito de Puno), ella tiene muchos clientes, ya que el calzado que vende es de muy buena calidad y duran mucho, lo cual es perfecto para la zona tan agreste donde trabajan.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y recomendarles los mejores zapatos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frío que hace en la mina, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y tiene que realizarlo. Para más adelante espera tener una tienda muy grande de zapatos donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes.

Este es el primer préstamo de Florencia con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que quiere acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más responsables. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más zapatos y zapatillas para implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Florencia is 53 years old and a very hardworking and responsible woman. She lives in her own house and hopes to have a peaceful retirement. She sells shoes and slippers in the mining town of La Rinconada (located in the Province of San Antonio de Putina, Puno District). Florencia has many customers because the footwear she sells is of good quality and very durable, which is perfect for this region of wilderness where many people work.

What Florencia enjoys most about her job is conversing with her customers and recommending the best shoes for them. She has been in business for 20 years and considers the most difficult challenge to be enduring the cold weather in this region, yet she knows that there is work for her to do. In the future, she would like to open a large shoe store where she can better serve her customers.

This is Florencia’s first loan with MFP. She is willing to make her payments on time because she wants to be able to access subsequent loans. Florencia is one of the more responsible members of her Communal Bank. With a loan of 1000 soles, she plans to purchase more shoes and slippers in order to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of footwear

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn A. is from the village of Capucao, Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees and save for future needs.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay K., 28, lives with her two young children in the Takeo province. She runs a business from home selling CDs VCDs to earn a living and is able to make about US$1 of profit every day, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver who is able to around US$4 per day. Chhay K. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband so that he can operate a moto-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene tiene 63 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho para salir adelante, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Su tienda de abarrotes es una de las más concurridas de su barrio, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera en abrir.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 20 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, ya que tiene que atender de corrido si no quiere que sus ventas bajen. Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el almacén principal de su barrio.

Este el quinto préstamo de Irene con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes y así incrementará su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Irene is 63 years old. She is a woman who has worked hard throughout her life in order to get ahead. Irene lives in her own home and hopes to have a peaceful retirement. She manages a grocery store in one of the more crowded areas of her neighborhood. Her charismatic and kind personality makes her popular amongst her neighbors, who do not hesitate to shop early because her store is one of the first to open.

What she enjoys most about her job is talking with her customers about events that occur in the neighborhood. Irene has been in business for 20 years and says the most difficult part is spending all day inside her store, yet she knows that she has to continually attend to customers if she does not want sales to decline. In the future, she hopes to increase her business so that it becomes the largest store in the neighborhood.

This is Irene’s fifth loan with MFP. She knows she has to make her payments on time in order to access more loans without creating complications for her Communal Bank. Irene is revered by the other members of her group. With a loan of 2000 soles, she plans to buy more provisions for her grocery store and increase her inventory of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Enrequita

texts.en:
Enrequita P. is from the village of Matipas, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Enrequita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes from selling mobile phone credit loads in the local community. Enrequita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Enrequita joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Enrequita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say C., 35, is married and lives with her husband and two young children in Takeo province. She sells bananas and typically makes about $2 USD of profit each day. Her husband, a motor-taxi driver, is able to make around $2.60 USD every day. Say is asking for a loan of $600 USD for her husband to purchase a motorbike to operate a moto-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike taxi for her husband

loans.name: Isolina

texts.es:
Isolina, de 52 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia y tiene muchas ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se dedica a la venta de calentadoras, radios, ollas, relojes, etc, básicamente todo lo que es usado en un hogar. Su puesto es muy concurrido, ya que atiende muy cordialmente a sus clientes.

Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar la mercadería que vende, ya que compra todos los productos en la ciudad de Desaguadero (distrito de Puno, fronterizo con el país de Bolivia) y le es muy cansado. Para más adelante espera tener una tienda grande donde pueda vender sus productos con más tranquilidad.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Isolina con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más cumplidas y responsables. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Isolina is 52 years old, and a loving and hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her family, and she would love to improve her quality of life. Her business is located in the San José market - a very important market in the city of Juliaca - where she sells heaters, radios, pots and pans, watches, etc. - anything one could use in a home. Her stall is very popular, as she provides great customer service. What Isolina loves most about her business is talking to the ladies in the neighboring stalls. She has been in this business for 17 years; she thinks transporting the products from the city of Desaguadero (district of Puno, in the border with Bolivia) to her stall is the most difficult task of all and leaves her very tired. In the future, she would like to have a larger store from which to sell her products more easily. This is Isolina's sixth loan with Kiva partner MFP; she is determined to pay all her installments timely. In her communal bank, she is one of the most responsible and reliable members. With the PEN 1,500 she is requesting, she will buy more products to better her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak P., 55, lives with her husband and two of her children in the Takeo province. She raises chickens to earn a living and is able to make for less than US$1 each day. Her husband sells traditional medicines. He typically makes US$3.30 every day. This couple is also aided by one of the children who work in private company. Prak P. would like to take out a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Top

texts.en: Top S., 23, raises pigs to earn a living and is able to make US$2 every day. She lives in the Takeo province and has two young children living at home to support. Her husband has been running a moto-taxi business since 1999 and is able to make US$4 of profit each day. Top wants to make a new investment so that she reaches CREDIT to apply a loan of US$500 to purchase a cart that can squeeze sugar cane juice.

loans.use: To purchase a sugar cane squeeze-cart

loans.name: Muhitan

texts.en: A. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. His two oldest children, ages 10 and 9, attend a local school and his youngest child stays at home with his mother. A. operates a raw material business in his town where he sells things like sheep and goat skins. He started his business in 2000 with the help of some friends and eventually earned enough to buy his own truck in 2008. His raw material business is the most profitable in October and November, when Mongolians prepare meats that will be eaten during the winter. A. supplements his earnings from December through March by transporting and delivering coal to customers in his town. He would eventually like to expand his house as his children get older so that the family can be more comfortable. A. says, “I want to save enough money for my children’s education.” He is requesting a 1,300,000 tugrug (~910 USD) loan in order to purchase more raw materials for the upcoming busy season.

loans.use: To purchase more raw material such as sheep and goat skins to resell

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.es:
Leocadia, de 52 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. El trabajo de Leocadia es la venta de cubrecamas, su negocio principalmente lo realiza en las ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca, pero también vende su mercadería en la ciudades de Puno, Ayaviri, Azangaro, Huancané, sus cubrecamas son muy solicitados por sus clientes, ya que son de muy buena calidad y duran bastante.

Los días que no hay ferias en la región, los puede aprovechar para realizar los trabajos de su hogar, lleva 12 años con este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es transportar su mercadería a los lugares donde los va a vender. Para el fututo anhela tener una tienda muy G. dedicada específicamente a la venta de cubrecamas.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Leocadia con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más cubrecamas para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Leocadia is 52 years old, a woman who is hard-working and a fighter. She lives in her own home with her family, and what she wishes most is to be successful in life. Leocadia sells bedspreads; her business operates mostly in the street markets of the city of Juliaca, but she also sells her products in the cities of Puno, Ayaviri, Azangaro, and Huancané. Very popular with her customers, her bedspreads are of good quality and they last a long time. On the days when street markets are not in operation, Leocadia makes the most of her time by doing house work. She has been in this business for 12 years and thinks the most difficult part is transporting her products to the selling points. In the future, she would love to have a large store to sell her bedspreads specifically. This is Leocadia's fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP; she is determined to pay her installments on time to avoid troubling the other member of her communal bank, where she is loved for the responsibility she demonstrates. With the PEN 3,000 she is requesting, she will buy more bedspreads in order to offer her customers more variety. .

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom S. was born in 1954, a married woman and is the good mother blessed with five children. Three of them are married and live separately, while the other two are single and are employed workers in Thailand. Mom S. cultivates a rice crop to earn a living, while her husband helps be responsible for family by working as a building worker. Mom S. currently lacks farming supply to help support her labor on the farm, so she would like a loan from Kiva in order to buy a cultivating machine which she will use them to plow her farmland. In addition, she will rent a new machine to other farmer for fees.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine which she will use them to plow her farmland

loans.name: Sart

texts.en: Sart S., 24, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. To earn a living, she operates a grocery store from her home, and is able to make $1.60 USD each day, while her husband makes $2.50 USD by running a moto-taxi. Sart S. would like to take a loan of $700 USD for her husband to replace his unreliable motorcycle.

loans.use: To replace an old motorcycle

loans.name: Lino

texts.es:
Lino, de 25 años, es un joven muy trabajador y alegre, vive en una habitación alquilada y tiene ganas de trabajar muy duro para salir adelante. Desde muy joven Lino se interesó por la carpintería, es por eso que decidió aprender y practicar este oficio. Actualmente tiene su propio taller de carpintería y le va muy bien, tiene muchos pedidos para cumplir y sabe que tiene que cumplirlos todos, si quiere que su negocio siga creciendo.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es moldear la madera y sacar los diseños que el quiere, lleva 4 años con este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es darle los toques finales a los trabajos, ya que le toma mucho tiempo, anhela que con el tiempo su negocio crezca y se convierta en una de las carpinterías más conocidas de la ciudad de Juliaca.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Lino con MFP, está dispuesto a pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy respetuoso con el resto de socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más madera para fabricar nuevos muebles y así cumplir mejor con sus pedidos.

loans.use: Compra de madera

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich T., 34, is a motor-taxi driver who is able to make a living of $2.50 USD every day. He lives with his wife and three of his children in Takeo province. His wife, pictured here, is a professional craftswoman who makes hammocks to sell at the local market. The couple are supported by one of their children who works for a private company. Pich T. is asking for a loan of $500 USD to purchase a motorbike to run a motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Nori

texts.es:
Nori, de 32 años, es una madre muy amorosa, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijos: Joaquín de 13 y Milagros de 10 años, a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios. El puesto de Nori está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se dedica a la venta de cubrecamas para bebés, las cuales trae desde las ciudades de Tacna y Desaguadero, ya que es ahí donde llegan los nuevos modelos y es debido a estas novedades que su puesto es muy concurrido.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en el mercado, lleva 10 años realizando es actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse en la madrugada para abrir su puesto de venta, ya que la gente acostumbra ir de compras muy temprano. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda de ropa en la cual pueda atender mejor a sus clientes.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Nori con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, puesto que no quiere perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la alegría que le pone al grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Nori, 32, is a loving mom who lives in her own home with her two children, Joaquín, 13, and Milagros, 10, to whom she would like to give a good education. Nori's stall is located in the San José market (a very important market in the city of Juliaca). She sells baby bedspreads that she brings from the cities of Tacna and Desaguadero, where the new models arrive. Because of the novelty of her bedspreads, her stall is very popular. What she likes most about her job is chatting with the ladies in the neighboring stalls and finding out about what is happening in the market. Nori has been in this business for 10 years; the most difficult part of her job is getting up in the morning to open her stall for customers, as they tend to shop in the very early hours of the day. In the future, Nori would like to have a clothing store from which to provide better service to her customers. This is Nori's sixth loan with Kiva partner MFP; she is determined to pay her installments on time to avoid troubling the other members of her communal bank, where she is loved for the joy with which she infuses the group. With the PEN 1,500 she is requesting, she will buy more products in order to better equip her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin P., 36, is a professional craftswoman from Takeo province. Since 2005, she has been using beads and other materials to make flowers on women's clothing. Typically, she makes $3 USD each day. The decorative dresses Yin makes are a kind of Khmer traditional dress worn during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around seven to ten days to complete each dress and each one is expensive. Most people prefer this type of dress to be handmade rather than machine-made. Yin knows how to decorate as she learned from her mother and started in the business before she was married. Her husband, pictured here, is a worker who is able to make a living of $1 USD per day. Yin P. is asking for a loan of $500 USD to purchase silk and beads.

loans.use: To purchase silk and beads

loans.name: Munkhdorj

texts.en:
Munkhdorj E. is 48 years old and lives with her son and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a small house in the city. Her son currently attends college and her mother is retired. E. manages a clothing and consumer goods trading business from a stall at a local market. She sells a variety of clothing items and her business is most profitable during the cold winter and spring months.

After graduating college, E. worked as a cook for ten years before starting her own business selling consumer goods in 1990. At this time, Mongolia was making a major transition to a democratic government and free market economy. In 2008, after several years of stable earnings, she used her savings to expand her business and began selling clothes in addition to consumer goods. She also moved to her current location at the market.

E. is a very hardworking and decent person. She is very focused on making her business successful as it is the only source of income for her family. She says, "My only wish is to provide for my son's education and help him to be a better person." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase different clothes to expand her product line.

loans.use: To purchase different clothes to expand her product line

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren E. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives together with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her son currently attends a local secondary school and her daughter is in kindergarten. Her husband works as a driver in the city.

E. operates a sausage and egg trading business out of a rented stall at a local market. She started her business in 2006 after working for five years at a private company as a quality control officer. She enjoys her work, but says, "It is difficult to work in a place where you smell sausage all of the time.”

For the future, E. hopes to expand her business by offering a wider variety of products and by renting a second stall at the market. Her business is very important to her and her family, and she works very hard to improve their quality of life. She dreams of one day being able to build a house.

E. is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more consumer products in order to expand her product line.

loans.use: To purchase more products in order to expand her product line

loans.name: Bibi Sabo Kweta Group

texts.en: Bibi Sabo Kweta is the group leader of Bibi Sabo Kweta group. There are four members in this group. They are wants to take a loan for expanding business and make it larger. So they are requested a group of loan 28000 Afghani. Baren Sabo wants to take a loan for her husband who has fuel selling shop. Hameda wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Kweta wants to take a loan for her brother who has metal working shop. Samera wants to take a loan for her husband who his taxi driver. They  thank AFS and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Banaris Group

texts.en: Banaris is the loan group leader. He is married and the father of two children. He lives in Jalalabad city. With hard work, Banaris organized a loan group of of three members, each one of them busy with different tasks. Banaris is a taxi driver. Noor M. has a business in used metals and ZainuD. is busy with leather working. They want to strengthen their businesses so they formed this loan group and have requested a group loan with each member needing 10000 (AF) to further their work.  Banaris assures that they can repay the loan on time and he can control the whole group. He would like to thank everyone at kiva for making this lending process available in Afghanistan and another poor counties.

loans.use: They want to increase their operating funds and supplies.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom T., 45, is a widow who lives with one of her children in the Takeo province. She is a professional decorates handicrafts. Since 1996, she has been using beads and other materials to make flower on woman clothes to earn a living and typically making US$2.5 each day. Decorates dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wears it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and its price is expensive too. Most of the people prefer hand made than machine made. She said she knows how to decorate from her mother and she has started doing that business since she was not married yet. Her son who lives with her is a car driver. He typically makes US$2 each day. Mom T. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase more silk and beads to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy silk and beads.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
At the age of 35, Imelda wants to renovate her pig pens and purchase 1 hog to raise, so she decided to  ask for a loan of PHP 7,000.00 from Kiva lenders. When she butchers 1 hog every 3 months her net income is PHP 1,500.00. This enables her to increase her income and to continue to satisfy the needs of her hog-raising business.

She is married to Mr. Aniceto D., a farmer, they have 3 children namely: Joyce- 15 years of age, 4th year high school student, followed by Jimmy- 14 years of age, 3rd year high school student, and their youngest is Jona- 10 years old, grade 4 student. They are presently residing at Pulo San Francisco, Cauayan City, a rural plain area. She gives priority to her family and meets their daily needs.

loans.use: Renovation of her pig pens and purchase some hog to raise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Chhum S., 45, is a widow and resides with one of her children in Takeo province. She is a professional clothes decorator. Since 1997, she has been using beads and other materials to make flower designs on women’s clothes to earn a living and typically makes US$2.50 each day.

A decorated dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and women wear it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and so its price is expensive. Most of the people prefer hand made over machine made, though. Chhum said she learned how to decorate from her mother and she started doing this business since before she was married.

Chhum is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase more silk and beads to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more silk and beads

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: Phin S., 31, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She is a professional decorates handicrafts. Since 1999, she has been using beads and other materials to make flower on woman clothes to earn a living and typically making US$2.5 each day. Decorates dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wears it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and its price is expensive too. Most of the people prefer hand made than machine made. She said she knows how to decorate from her mother and she has started doing that business since she was not married yet. Her husband stays at home helping his wife. Phin S. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase silk and beads to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase silk and beads.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
“Life is like a wheel: sometimes we are on top and sometimes we are at the bottom”. This inspiring quotation is shared by Mrs. Corazon P., the responsible housewife of Mr. Leon Penticostes. She and her family live peacefully in a village located at Barangay Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. They have two children, namely Ric Penticostes and Rod Penticostes. Both of them are now in secondary education and have the ambition of being successful someday in their chosen professions.

As parents, Mr. and Mrs. P. have the responsibility of supporting the education of their children. Despite hardships and difficulties they are striving to earn a living. They cultivate their farm lots by planting rice, vegetables and fruit.

Furthermore, Mrs. Corazon put-up a small sari-sari store (variety store) in their village to earn additional income. She started this with little capital amounting to PHP 4,000. As a fruit of her patience and sacrifices, she is able to earn a net income of PHP 6,000 which they use to satisfy their needs and finance the schooling of their children.

Since her business is profitable, Mrs. Corazon wants to improve it by acquiring additional products to sell. Thus, she wants to use a loan of PHP 5,000 from the microfinance organization as additional capital for acquiring these products. She believes that, with proper management of her capital, she will be able to improve her small sari-sari store and earn a higher income to support the education of their two children.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Soaila Shiab Group

texts.en: Soaila Shiab is the leader of Soaila Shiab group. There are three members in this group. Each of them is requesting a loan to grow their businesses; they are requesting a group of loan 30,000 Afghani. Soaila requests a loan for her husband who has a electrical equipment repair business. Salma requests a loan for her husband who has video cassette shop. Gul Jan wants to request a loan for her son who is a tailor. They thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To grow businesses (repair shop, video store, tailor)

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a mother who wishes for a bright future for her children. She is already 42 years old and has a total of seven children. She is married to Alfredo D. R. who manages their farm lot located in their village of Santa Isabela Norte, Ilagan, Isabela. Among their seven children, three are now in school.

Visitacion hopes to provide for all of the children so they can finish their studies. She envisions that someday her children will live better and more comfortable lives compared to the poor status of living they are experiencing at the moment.

Visitacion is involved in managing a hog-raising business. She hopes that her livestock business will be improved with the help of Kiva lenders who are willing to lend to her. She wants to request PHP 4,000 to use as added business capital in purchasing a feed supply for the pigs she is raising. She believes that seeking the help of lenders is one way of making her business grow and becoming a success in life.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Esminia

texts.en:
Esminia, a 41-year-old businesswoman, lives with her husband, Salvador, in the village of San Vicente, Quirino, Isabela. They are blessed with three children and all have graduated from high school. They are not pursuing their studies in college because they are not interested in doing so. However, they now have their own sources of income and Esminia is glad that they’re trying to find what’s best for them.

Esminia is in the livestock business but so far she only has one hog. So she decided to engage in another business. She is now planning to start-up a retail business in their village. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 as starting capital. If given the chance, she will make it productive in the best way she can in order to provide better living conditions for her family. She hopes that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: To use as start-up capital for a retail business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn is engaged in retailing barbeque in their village. She wants to have more products to sell such as vegetables and fishes. She hopes to have additional capital to further grow her business. For this reason, she would like to ask for a loan of PHP4,000 to help her attain her goal with her business. She hopes that she will be given the chance to expand her business because their family’s daily allowances come from her business.
	“Try and try until you succed”, this is what Edlyn’s guiding principle in life. She is just a 23 years old mother who lives together with her husband and two children. As a newly parent, she is trying to earn income to the best of her ability. She hopes to give her two children the life that they deserve. She hopes that someday she could send them to school up to the highest level. Their family lives peacefully in the village of La Salette, Benito Soliven, Isabela.

loans.use: additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta has been engaged in her livestock business for two years. Just recently, she sold her adult hogs and now needs additional capital to maintain her hog raising business. Aside from hog raising, she also plants vegetables in her backyard for personal consumption. Sometimes, she also sells her vegetables to make a profit. Violeta hopes to use her loan request, amounting to PHP6,000, for her vegetables and livestock businesses. She hopes to have additional capital for the growth and maintenance of her businesses. 

	Violeta is just twenty-two years old and is married to Mr. Leny who is now twenty-six years old and works as a construction worker in their village. The couple has two children already. Their eldest, Mark Justine, is now studying as a kindergartner in primary school and their youngest, Precious is just six months old. Their family lives in the village of Minallo, Naguilian, Isabela.

loans.use: more hogs to raise and supplies for planting vegetable

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah M. is a young mother who lives in Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She was born on March 12, 1989 and only finished secondary education. She did not pursue college because she got married at an early age. Her husband is Mr. Rey M. and they are blessed with a child whom they called Reymarch M., a four year old boy. It is difficult for them to look for a job because they are only high school graduates. 
	So her husband cultivates their farm by planting a variety of vegetables. This is the common source of their income. When her son is on his best behavior Leah sells frozen foods and vegetables. She is the one who displays/sells their produce at the Public Market of Villa Coloma, bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Since she does not have enough money to acquire more frozen foods, she wants to be a member of the Lending institution in Solano and applied for a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to be used in acquiring more frozen foods and vegetables to be sold at retail. She is so happy and she believes that she can make her business grow through this financial assistance.

loans.use: additional capital for her process foods business

loans.name: Glorina

texts.en:
Being a parent, Glorina has a great ambition for her children, she sacrifices everything for the sake of her children.Glorina and Roger D. a husband and wife who have eight children are striving hard to give them a better future. They live harmoniously in a village located at Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag,Nueva Vizcaya.
	The common source of their living is through farming, they till their farm lot for two cropping, by planting variety of vegetables and rice. Furthermore, Glorina engages in duck raising to earn additional income. With her interest to increase the number of their ducks, she wants to borrow additional capital in a Microfinance organization to purchase additional ducks and the needed materials for their maintenance. Finally, she applied an amount of P 5,000.00 to be added in her capital in acquiring the said additional ducks and for their maintenance and also for the improvement of their crop production. They believed that someday, their children will finish their studies and the status of their living will be improve through their patience and sacrifices with the financial support of the said organization. As they have said, “ if there is patience, there is success.”

loans.use: additinal capital for her duck raising business

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda has been involved in the livestock business for ten years. Raising hogs is what she does to help her husband bring in income for their family. She aspires to be more productive in her business to help sustain the educational needs of her children.

For the second time, Gilda would like to ask for a PHP 20,000 loan from Kiva lenders to have additional capital for purchasing piglets and a sufficient supply of feed. She hopes that she will again be granted her request because it will be a big help in the maintenance and development of her livestock business.

“Love is the greatest gift of God”. This is what Gilda believes in life, and the reason why she is fond of helping others, because she shares the love God has given us. She is married to Pedro V. and is blessed with three children. They are currently studying and are in different school levels. She hopes that they will all finish their studies, including college. She believes that her diligence in working and her husband’s patience in farming will help them achieve their dreams.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is again here to request a loan of PHP 7,000 from lenders. She would like to further improve and grow her business which involves retailing and cultivation of vegetables in her backyard. The loan will be used as her additional revolving capital in purchasing more vegetables and fruits to sell. She is also planning to buy more vegetables to plant in her vegetable garden.

Lilibeth and her husband are planning to purchase hogs to raise. They believe that it will help them in time of their need. She hopes that lenders will continuously support her business because it really provides most of their family needs.

Lilibeth is now 23 years old and has two children. Joanna, her eldest is now two years old and her youngest is just one month old. Lilibeth is hoping to give a good future to her children by striving hard to succeed in her business. Her husband who is a painter is very supportive with her business. He cultivates their farm and helps her in her business most of the time.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica P., 38 years of age, is married to Edwin P., who works as a farmer. They have two children. Anthony is 17 years of age and a fourth year high school student. They are happily residing in San Francisco, Alicia Isabela, a rural area, most of the people residing in their village are from Sta.Rosa, Nueva Ecija.

She has managed a livestock business for almost 7 years, her net income every 3 months is PHP 2,000.00. Aside from hog-raising she is also a vegetable vendor and sells also rice cakes in their village. She decided to request a loan amount of PHP 7,000.00 for the renovation of her pig pens, and plans to purchase 1 hog to raise. She said that we should develop patience to have productive businesses.

loans.use: Renovation of her Pig pens

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is engage in bamboo furniture making business. She is so happy for having the skill to make a furniture using bamboos because she is making income out of it. Aside from this, she is also engaged in hog raising business. She needed additional capital for the improvement of her business to earn bigger income. She hopes to avail a starting loan of at least PHP4,000 to be able to buy more materials to be use in furniture making. She wants to improve and make her business profitable.

	Belen is married to Marcelino who is already 45 years old. He is working in their farm and they help each other in their businesses. They have six children in all. Their eldest and second child are not studying and it is their decision to stop studying. Three of their children are still studying in elementary school and their youngest is just six months old.  The couple is striving hard to be successful in their respective business. They hope that someday they will be able to elevate their ways of living through the businesses that they are managing.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy materials to be use in making furniture

loans.name: Alejo

texts.en:
Mr.Alejo C. J.., 45 years of age, is married to Melissa C., and they  are blessed with three loving children namely: Alejo C. III, 23 years of age, working in Dubai, as a stocker in a hypermarket, followed by Philip C., 16 years of age, 1st year college student, and their youngest is Geebee, 14 years of age, 2nd year high school student at Alicia Vocational School. They are living at San Francisco Alicia, his wife is also working in Dubai as an OFW (Overseas factory worker). Their house is near at the baranggay hall, beside the irrigation area.

Alejo is a tricycle driver and operator, and also a baranggay councilor in their village, his daily net income is minimum PHP 150.00, and maximum 300.00, he plans to use a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 5,000.00 for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle (part of the tricycle). He wants to help his wife by providing additional income to support the education of their children.

loans.use: Repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 31 years old, married and has two children who are both studying. She and her family lives in the village of La Salette, Benito Soliven, Isabela. Paulina believes that God mercy those who help themselves. As a mother of two, she needs to engage in a business to make a living. 
Paulina is engaged in retailing business since having her own family. She is vending cooked food and vegetables as well. She retails her products everyday in their village. Her products depend upon the capital she has, most of the time her income is just sufficient for the daily consumption of her family. This is one of the reasons why Paulina requests an amount of PHP4,000 to have additional revolving capital to expand her business. The loan will be of big help to her family because she will have the chance to buy more retail products and make her business gain more income. She hopes that her loan will be approved.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a single man living with his parents. He's 25 years old. He has owned a car repair shop since 2007 to provide, along with his father, better life conditions for the family. Today, he wants to take out a loan of $1000 to buy more spare parts and perform maintenance for the machineries to enlarge his shop to meet the requirement of his clients and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: buy more spare parts and perform maintenance for the machineries

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 30-year-old single man living with his mother and brother. He has been working as a home painter since 2002 to earn income. Today, Ibrahim is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new tools for his work to be able to satisfy the needs of his clients and continue earning a good income for the family.

loans.use: buy new tools

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria R. dreams of improving the lifestyle of her family and tries to work hard and do her best. She is married to Dominador R., a farmer and they are gifted with two children namely: Nancy and Diego. Nancy has not finished her studies because of the unlucky economic crisis. Diego is presently studying to achieve a Bachelor of Science in Agriculture. Mrs. R. dreams of helping her son finish his studies so he will be able to obtain a good job.

Mrs. R. said that the profits from her store play a big role in her life. The store helps her pay for the school fees and allowances of her son, Diego. She wants to continue selling goods in her sari-sari store (variety store) so she is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 28-year-old single man living with his parents and 3 brothers. He has owned a bus since 2001 where he services the neighboring villages. Today, Mohamad is asking for a loan of $1,200 to perform maintenance to the bus after being in bad circumstances to continue his work properly.

loans.use: perform maintenance to the bus

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn produces snacks that she sells in her village. She needs additional capital for the growth of her business and she is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000. With the loan she will instantly purchase stocks of ingredients she needs for cooking. She believes that by having sufficient capital to run her business it will become more productive, which will bring her more income. This will benefit her children, most of whom are still studying.

Jovelyn, a thirty-six-year-old business woman, is from the village of Cabisera 25, Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Noli who operates a passenger jeepney (a small bus) which they own. They have five children: Noel - 17; Nolie Jr. - 15; Dennis - 13; Marvin - 7; and Harv Jhone - nine months old.

Jovelyn wishes to provide a good future to all her children. No matter how hard it is to have a big family, she knows that they will be able to attain their dreams as long as there is a strong determination among them.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to expand her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 23-year-old single man. He has owned a cafe called “Friends” in his town since 2004 to begin a new career and to improve his living conditions.

Today, Salam is requesting $1,000 to buy more merchandise for his shop to satisfy the needs of the market and to expand his shop after becoming known by the neighboring villages.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his café

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga makes a living through her hog raising business. She has one mother pig and piglets that she raise in their backyard. She hopes to maintain the supply of feeds for her pigs. Her income from selling some of her hogs  had helped her put up a variety store which gives her a net income of PHP300 daily. She hopes to have additional capital to improve her new business and maintain her hog raising business. Dominga is requesting to avail a loan of PHP4,000 for the maintenance of her hog raising activity.
	Dominga is 30 years old businesswoman who aims to progress in their business. She is married already and has three school-aged children.  Their family lives happily in the village of La Salette, Benito Soliven, Isabela.

loans.use: additional capital for the maintenance of her hog raising business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita has been dreaming to alleviate her poor living condition someday. She is married to Ceser who works as a farmer in their village. They have four children.  Clarito, twenty-two years old and Arlene, twenty years old, are both married already. Armie, her third child, is now in Manila working as a maid.  Their youngest is seventeen years old and has finished studying. Her family lives in the village of Santa Isabel Norte, Ilagan, Isabela. 
	
Anita has been engaged in her hog raising business for years. For daily income, she also sells vegetables to their entire village. She retails her vegetable products which she purchases from the town market. She hopes to gain more profit from both of her businesses to able provide the primary needs of her family. 

Anita is requesting to use a loan of PHP4,000 to have capital to purchase a supply of feed for her hogs, vegetables and other commodities that she may add to her product line. She hopes to use the loan because she believes that it is the best way to make her businesses more productive. By growing her businesses, she believes that their ways of living will somehow be uplifted.

loans.use: expanding both her livestock and retail business

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is a single man living with his parents and 4 brothers. He has owned an auto cleaning shop and car oil changing since 2007. He works hard to support his family in collaboration with his brother. Today, Jamal is requesting a loan of $1,200 to perform maintenance for the cleaning machine and buy additional oil changing bottles to develop his work.

loans.use: perform maintenance for the cleaning machine and buy additional oil changing bottles

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 56-year-old married man and the father of two children. For eighteen years he has owned a delivery van as his own business.

After this long experience, Youssef is applying for a loan of $800 to perform maintenance on his van to be able to properly continue his work.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his van

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita G. is 10 years older to her husband Jerry G. who is now 31 years old. But their age gap had never been a reason for them to have a same goal in life which is to give their children Abegail 15 years old, Kennedy age 14, Anthea age 12, Nicole age 7 and Axel Rose 4 years old, a better life. Their 5 children are now currently studying so more expenses for the schooling of them plus the expenses in their everyday living.

Last year she joined to Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), now she will have a second loan to them which she’ll be use in her fishing business that been their main source of income to make it more productive. She will use it for buying motor for their boat that used by them in catching fish in the sea then selling it to the market or in their neighborhood.

One dreams of Warlita is to save for the future of their children, she really wants them to finish their studies so that they can help their self to improve their way of living.

loans.use: To buy motor for boat that use in her fishing business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 31-year-old married man and has two children who are still in school. He has been working as a flooring man since 2006 and has six years of experience in this field.

Today, Ali is requesting $1,000 to buy additionA. supplies and tools in order to develop his business.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies and tools

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
At her age of 48, Juanita T. is already 15 years in her business. Her business is piggery. She is guided with her principle in life that “poverty is not the hindrance to success”. It is the grounds to move on and it is a challenge on how you carry out the present situation. She is gifted with one child and currently studying at this moment. Juanita dreams that her business will become successful to be able to help her child to finish his studies.

In relation to her dreams, she wanted to borrow the amount of Php 12,000 for the maintenance of her pigs feeds. She plans to sell her pigs because she is insufficient in budget of her pigs feeds. She is hoping that she will belong to those who availed loan from KIVA lenders. She believes that her business will still remain because she does not need to sell her pigs if she will given the chance to avail her loan requested.

loans.use: for purchasing feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 26-year-old single man. In 2004, he decided to own a van to work as a van driver as his own business after 10 years of experience. That's how he will earn money and improve his living situation. Today, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $1,000 to change the wheels on his van to continue his work properly.

loans.use: To buy new wheels

loans.name: Hanieh

texts.en: Hanieh is a 49-year-old single woman. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 2005 to earn income to satisfy the needs of her old mother. Hanieh is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a new sewing machine and additional textiles to meet the requirement of her clients and make a good income.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine and additional textiles

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en: Wassim is a 31-year-old single man living with his parents and brothers. He has been irrigating the agriculture fields in neighboring villages since 2000. He works daily as per the demands of the clients. Today, Wassim is requesting to borrow $600 to purchase new irrigation tools to expand and develop his work.

loans.use: To purchase new irrigation tools

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa and her husband Larry P. are blessed with two children namely; Elmalyn- 17 years of age, 2nd year college student, and Crisel Joy- 16 years of age, 4th year high school student. They are living at the area of San Francisco in Alicia, a rural and plain area, were people have their own unique ways in dealing with their business.
She operates a retail store for almost 12 years now, her weekly net income is PHP 800.00. At present she decided to avail a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 7,000.00 to purchase grocery items and some beverages to sell in her small general store. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her loan as soon as possible. She said that "happiness and blessings will come, if you know how to share your blessings". That's why she is very friendly to her customers and she is always willing to extend help to them especially in times of trials.

loans.use: Additional Capital to purchase more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Maria Nina

texts.en:
At the age of 24 Maria Nina Z. is raising a 2 years old child. She is a single mother to her son John Carlo, her partner left her with the promise of in his return they will get married but until now he never come back. She is the only one taking care of their child, her father Isidro Z. is the one helping her in times that she need help especially in financial. Because her father is working now as a laborer sometimes he helps her in expenses for her child. But Maria Nina doesn’t want that her father will always provide for them, so thinks of way how to earn income so that she can raise her child on her own. One source of their income is come from doing a manicure and pedicure to some customer, but it’s not enough for their expenses because now a days price of milk of baby cost too much. She thinks of another business that will earn more income. This is the start of her hog fattening business. This run for one year now and the revenue that came from it sustain their daily needs.

When she joined to Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) she used the loan that she received to this business, now she will do it again. She will use the loan in buying piglet to raise, different kinds of feeds for the piglet and vitamins for them. She will do this so that her business will grow more.

As a mother to a child Maria Nina really dreams to her child that he will have a better future, not experiencing what she experience not having a partner in life. But according to Maria Nina she is still hoping that their family will be complete someday. She never lost hope that it will happen.
