loans.use: To finance her hog fattening (raising of pigs) business

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en: Suzanne is a 24-year-old married woman with two children. She has owned a beauty salon since 2008 where she services the neighboring villages. She works hard to make a profit to help her husband. Today, Suzanne is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy more merchandise and beauty products to please her clients.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and beauty products

loans.name: Navy

texts.en: Navy T., 36, is married and resides with her three young children and her husband in the Takeo province. She is a professional decorator of handicrafts. Since 1996, she has been using beads and other materials to make flowers on women's clothes to earn a living, typically making US$2.5 each day. She decorates a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wear it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and the price is expensive too. Most of the people prefer handmade than machine made. She said she learned how to decorate from her mother and she started doing that business before she was married. Navy T. would like to take out a loan of US$400 to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy silk and beads.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun S., 63, is a widow who lives with two of her children in the Takeo province. She is an old mother who stays at home helping her daughter weave silk clothes. She is able to make about US$1.50 every day.  To earn more money, Chhun S. is asking for a loan of US$300 to purchase more silk to weave more clothes.

loans.use: Buy silk to weave clothes.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is an industrious father to his three children who are in the secondary and primary levels. He is also a loving husband to his wife Marjorie who is 35 years of age. Their family harmoniously resides at Barangay San Francisco, Alicia, Isabela. He describes his village as a peaceful place. Their sources of income are motorcycle transport and farming.

He has operated a retail store for almost a year. His weekly net income is PHP 250.00. While in his motorcycle transport business, he has a daily net income of PHP 200.00, and in farming he earns PHP 10,000.00 net income for three months. He wants to increase his income to support his children's education, for a better future. He requested a loan amount of PHP 7,000.00 for his additional working capital in his general store business.

loans.use: Additional capital for his general store

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie S. is already 35 years old and she is married to Rodolfo S.. They have three children, they are; Mary Grace- 16 years of age, fourth year high school student, next to her is Dianalyn- 15 years of age, 3rd year high school student, and their youngest is Rodolfo Jr.- 13 years of age, grade 6 student. Their house is located near the rice fields, and fish ponds at San Francisco, Alicia, Isabela. 

 She manages a hog raising business for almost two years now, when she sells one hog, her net income is PHP 1,100.00. She plans to avail from KIVA lenders the loan amounting to PHP 3,000.00 to purchase some hog feeds and to build a shelter to her hogs, she hopes that KIVA will grant her loan request as soon as possible, to have a continuous business that is growing and improving.

loans.use: Additional Capital to buy hog feeds and to build pig pens

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina I. is now 42 years old married to Hospicio I. now 65 years old work in their place as a Barangay Kagawad, an elected government official who is a member of the Barangay Council (a smallest political unit in the Philippines. Her husband is older than her by 23 years that is why it is more responsible in making income for their family. But Dina as a mother of 4 children Hydin 18 years old, Mary Genevive 17 years old, Jun David 16 years old and Jayvee 14 years old, is very concern with her children in terms of their education. She wants her children finish their studies until college. So Dina thinks of another way to help her husband in making income for them. This is the start of her business which is buy and sells of different kind of fish which place in the market near in their house.

Her first problem is where she will get a capital to start this business. The solution came up when she joined to Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI). She used the loan that she received as a capital to start this business. Now she will use again the loan that she received for this business. She will buy necessary things needed by her business like assorted fish to be sell, container with Styrofoam, ice for preserving the fish and weighing scale. Also she wants to use it for her secondary business which raising of pigs, she will buy another piglet to raise and feeds for them.

Dina really wish that her business will continue to run, for her to be able to reach her dream of someday her children will be a degree holder.

loans.use: For additional capital to her buy & sell of fish business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina B. is popular in her nickname as “ Marie” in their village located at Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcya. She is 45 years old and finished her secondary education. Due to financial shortage, she did not pursue her college studies. She works hard to earn a living until she got married to Teodoro B. Jr. and they are gifted with two children namely Caroline B. and Diana Rose B..  Being a responsible parent, both of their children are now in college level taking up different degree. Despite our economic crisis, they are still striving for the sake of the future of their children.
	Her husband is one of the soldiers who are assigned in Manila while she is engaged in selling snacks in their village to help her husband in earning income to support the education of their children. Since she only have small capital, she only earns a net income of P 600.00 per week. In this regard, she wants to borrow additional capital to strengthen her business. She tried to apply an amount of P 5,000.00 to be added in her capital to acquire materials and ingredients needed for her business. She is so thankful when she joins in this organization because it gives her the opportunity to improve her small business. And she hopes that through her efforts and sacrifices, their two children will finish their studies and her business will also grow. As she have said,” Patience and sacrifices are the key to success.”

loans.use: additional capital to buy more ingredients needed in her business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulties, Rosalie did not pursue her college studies, she helps her parents to earn a living and support the schooling of her younger brothers and sisters. At the age of 18, she is married to Roger B. and they are blessed with ten children, five of them are male and five are female. 
	For the sake of their children’s future, she and her husband helps each other to earn income. Her husband works as electrician in Solano while Rosalie engages in selling cooked dishes, snacks and vegetables  in front of their house. Since her business is beneficial, she decided to continue and improve it. But due to financial difficulty, encourages her to borrow additional capital amounting to P 5,000.00 to increase her capital in improving her small business. She is hoping that with this financial assistance, she can able to improve her business and increase her income and finance the schooling of their children. As she have said, Nothing is impossible if you are responsible!...

loans.use: additional capital for the improvement of her food production business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is indulged in managing her own variety store located just in front of their house. She is requesting to avail a loan of PHP5,000 to have additional capital to maintain and further improve her store business. She wants to buy more stocks of products for her store. She hopes to avail her request for her business to become more productive. Her income from the business is being used to sustain the daily needs of her children and she hopes that through the loan they will all be benefited.
	Lilia, 35 years old, is already married and has three school-aged children. As a mother, Lilia never loses hopes in trying to reach success. She knows that she needs to be strong and patient in dealing with her responsibilities. She wanted to provide sufficient needs of her family especially their children because their future depends on them as parents.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more stocks of products for her store

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita B. is already 52 years old, she is engaged into poultry business for almost two years, she sells one cobb for PHP 150.00, she applied a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 3,000.00 for her additional capital to purchase some feeds for her poultry.She works hard to support her family, especially in financial aspect.

She is married to Armando B., who works as a farmer, they are blessed with three industrious children, they are;Michael- 28 years old, a factory worker, next to him is Melchor- 25 years of age, and their youngest is Melvin- 20 years old, they are both farmers.They are presently living at San Francisco, Alicia Isabela. Most of the people residing in their village are into farming and vending business. Their house is located near at irrigation area and rice fields.

loans.use: Additional Capital to purchase feeds for her poultry

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai T. T. P. was born in 1964. ( id: 010105040018). She lives in Lai Da – Dong Hoi – Dong Anh – Ha Noi with her husband and two children. Her two children are still going to school. Her husband is a pilot. She is a tailor. She has got loans from Microfund organization for three years and repaid them on time. She is a group leader. She has a monthly income of about 4.000.000 VND. This time, she wants to borrow 300 USD to buy goods to sell.
 There are 6 other Fund participants in her group . 
 Thúy Thị Ngô was born in 1969. ( id: 010105040023). She sells soup noodle in the morning. She wants to borrow 300 USD to invest her restaurand.
 Thúy Thị Hồng Vương was born in 1983. ( id: 010105040024). She is farming and breeding chicken. She wants to borrow 300 USD to buy food for chicken.
 Nhân Thị Nguyễn was born in 1956. ( id: 010105040022). She is farming and breeding chicken. She wants to borrow 250 USD to buy more chicken to raise.
 Kế Thị Lương was born in 1955. ( id: 010105040019). She is breeding chicken, cows. She wants to borrow 300 USD to buy food for them.
 Toàn Thị Lương was born in 1951. ( id: 010105040020). She wants to borrow 250 USD to breed the pigs and poultry.
 Phòng Thị Ngô was born in 1965. ( id: 010105040021). She is farming and breeding chicken. She wants to borrow 250 USD to buy more chicken to raise.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is here again to ask for financial assistance from KIVA lenders who once helped her with her business through her previous loan. She has been engaged in vending fruits and vegetables in their village for a long time. Her income from vending is being used to sustain her family’s daily needs. She hopes to maintain her business for the welfare of her family. 

Teresita requests a loan of PHP8,000 to use as her additional working capital to purchase more goods to sell. Some of her loan will also be used to sustain the vegetables that she planted in their backyard. It needs fertilizer and other medicines to have a good harvest. She hopes to avail the loan for the development of her business.

Teresita is married to Juanito who is also one of the farmers in their village. They have five children, four of whom are adults already. Their youngest is still attending high school and he is the only one left studying.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell and more fertilizer for her fields

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 54 years old and she is married with 5 children.She lives in Sapele, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells sarongs of various colours and shapes.She hopes to own a boutique in the future.She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Preab

texts.en: Mrs. Preab L. is a low-income 35 years of age. She currently depends on selling fish from home to home around the commune. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. Preab L. is a humble mother who has been blessed with two school-aged children. Now the river is full of fish due to the coming fish season. Preab L.’s husband can’t catch a lot of fish because he lacks tools to use for the fishing activities. Therefore, Preab L. has decided to seek a loan of US$400 which will enable her husband to purchase more tools to fish.

loans.use: To purchase more tools to fish

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena owns and manages a village store for already six years now. For its further development, she needs additional capital of PHP9,000. With this amount, she could already make her small store filled with more grocery items.  She hopes to avail her request because it will be very beneficial to the survival and maintenance of her variety store. Aside from her retail business, Rowena is also indulged in hog raising business. Before opening her store, she makes sure that her pigpen is already cleansed and her hogs are already ate their food. She plans to budget her loan in making both of her businessess improved. 

Rowena  is a 31 years old businesswoman who is married to Ellbert A.. They are blessed with one child in the person of John Carlo who is now five years old. Rowena hopes to sustain all the growing needs of her child especially now that he is already studying.  She hopes that by the time her children increases, she would be able to make her business more stable.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for the maintenance of her store

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam C., 30, is married with five children and resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her sister. She is currently employed in a local garment factory of producing textiles and fabric, earning an income of US $2 per day in revenue. Her husband is a soldier who works for the government, earning an income of US $2.6 per day. They try to work hard every day to ensure good living for their family, and start a new business to generate extra income for the future household use. C. is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase a car for her husband to provide transportation services from the town to tourist places in the province. She hopes that this future business plan will be successful so that she is able to support her children to study at a good school.

loans.use: buy a car

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 44 years old and she is residing in the village of Magsaysay, Naguilina, Isabela. She is happily married to Delfin who is busy cultivating their own farm located in their village. They are blessed with two children; their eldest already graduated in college and now employed as a security guard, and their youngest child did not able to finish his studies due to not having an interest in studying. 

	Lolita has been a year engaged in her general store business. She is managing a small village store where she sells grocery items and vegetables which is being displayed in front of their store. She asks for additional capital of PHP12,000 to further expand her retail business.
 Lolita has been a client of this organization and she hopes that her business will continuously be supported by KIVA lenders. The loan she availed in her previous loans had helped his business earn more income which she used to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: additional capital to further expand her retail business

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is a 50-year-old married woman with seven children. She has been selling tubers of yams for a long time to earn income to satisfy the needs of her children and husband. She hopes for a loan of N60,000 to purchase more tubers of yams to sell. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Sreng S., 44, is a housewife and has a three-year-old child. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured). To make a living, her husband operates his motor taxi at the local markets in the town, earning approximately an income of US $2.5 in revenue per day to cover his household expenses. This couple tries to work hard every day to ensure good living for their child and family. S. is seeking to improve her husband’s business, so she is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a motorbike that will enable her husband to provide efficient services to his customers because the his current motorbike is old and not reliable enough to attract people. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income to make a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Susan Wangari

texts.en:
Susan N. is 40 years old and a mother of two children.  She runs a retail general shop where she sells different goods for daily home use.  She has been in the business for about nine years with a profit of approximately 100,000 kenyan shillings. She has never borrowed from any MFI and was introduced to KADET by a friend.  Her clients are mainly from Kikuyu town where the business is. 

She has applied for a loan which she intends to use for adding more stock to her business to improve her profit margin.  

She hopes to open a wholesale store in order to sell in bulk and increase her living standards.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add more stock for different product

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 59 years old and a widow with four children. She sells sarongs of various colors to earn a living. This is her main source of income. It is the high season for sales now and she wants to take advantage of it to increase her profits. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She is indeed grateful to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
H. Lê V.  (20213010070) is a 33 year-old male living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh..  H. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is An Ninh2 - nhóm 13 (13).


H. is married and has 2 infant-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing new clothing services to local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 0, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA.    He is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trần Thị H. (20213010071) is a 26 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Chu Thị H.  (20213010072) is a 47 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


3.  Ngô Thị T. An (20213010073) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20213010074) is a 32 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Lê V.  (20213010070) là 33 tuổi nam.  A. ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh..  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là An Ninh2 - nhóm 13 (13).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doA. chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo mới cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doA. này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Vào 0, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doA. của cô ấy/ A. ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    A. ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trần Thị H. (20213010071) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Chu Thị H.  (20213010072) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  Ngô Thị T. An (20213010073) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là vận hành công việc kinh doA. quần áo.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20213010074) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DoA. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các dA. mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret sells second-hand clothes to make a living in her community in Sapele, Delta state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of 70,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. 

She is 52 years old and married with four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Loa

texts.en:
Loa S., 25, is married and has a 3-year-old child. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia, with her husband (pictured). 

To make a living, she is currently employed in a local garment factory, earning an income of $2 per day. Her husband is employed by a private company, earning an income of approximately $7 per day to cover his household expenses. This primary source of income helps his family a lot. This couple tries to work hard every day to ensure a good life for their child and family.

S. is seeking to improve her standard of living by starting another business, so she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase animal food for her pigs. She hopes she will be able to generate more income with the expected loan, which she will invest in raising pigs.

loans.use: Buy pig food

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 47years old and married with 5 children. She sells furniture wood. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000, to purchase more furniture wood. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to sell.

loans.name: Loem

texts.en:
Mrs. Loem S. is 33 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh Capital, where she owns and operates a small café business. She is able to generate a profit of $3 per day. Another source of family income comes from her husband, who drives a taxi. This couple has three children, all of whom are going to school and are dependent on their income. 

Since Loem S.’s husband's taxi doesn’t accommodate many passengers while he is providing his service, Loem S. would like a Kiva loan of $1,000 for her husband to purchase a new one, which will be larger than the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a new taxi

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine sells groceries at the front of her house in Sapele, Delta state, Nigeria.She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is 50 years old and married with 8 children.she says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery to sell

loans.name: Ogiesoba

texts.en: F. is 55 years old and married with 6 children. She sells yams and other foodstuffs very close to her house.   She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.name: Sroeun

texts.en: Mrs. Sroeun K. lives in Smaung village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder to make duck eggs to sell. Her husband, Mr. Auch Tha, is a farmer who owns 2-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income to support their family living. Now Mrs. Sroeun K. is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike to transport duck eggs to sell in the local market. She is 40 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: Is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike to transport duck eggs to sell in the local market.

loans.name: 02.05.1.9 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
"Loan N. Thị (51) is a 35 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Loan is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 9 Nam Ngan (08.1.9 Nam Ngan).


Loan is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Loan owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community.  Loan has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1500000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Loan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Loan is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    She is now requesting a new loan of 3000000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Loan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Lan (48) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 3000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  M. Thị Hồng (47) is a 21 year-old female who is requesting a 3000000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


3.  C. Thị H. Giang (52) is a 22 year-old female who is requesting a 3000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


4.  T. Thị Hồng (53) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 3000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


5.  H. Thị Bình  (54) is a 32 year-old female who is requesting a 3000000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Loan N. Thị (51) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Loan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 9 Nam Ngan (08.1.9 Nam Ngan).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa pH..  Loan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Loan kiếm được khoảng 1500000 VND.  Vào 2009, Loan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Loan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Lan (48) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  M. Thị Hồng (47) là 21 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


3.  C. Thị H. Giang (52) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  T. Thị Hồng (53) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


5.  H. Thị Bình  (54) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Savut

texts.en: Mr. Savut K. lives in Kampong Chrey village in Takeo province. He is a motorbike taxi driver. His wife, Mrs. Kiev Chantha, is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. Aside from this farm, she is a pig breeder. Since her pig breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Savut K. decided to ask for a loan to buy ten more piglets and pig food. He hopes to increase income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. He is 28 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the other is just three years old. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets and livestock feed

loans.name: Mrs. Han Chhay Group Loan

texts.en:
Han C. is the leader of a group with five members who all live in Klaong Tvear village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food, and she would use the rest of money to buy ducks for breeding. Her husband, Nhoeb Chhar, is a farmer who owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. This couple has five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, one who is attending the local school and two who are too young to work or study. 

Three members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-Term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed, as well as ducks for breeding

loans.name: Osayomore

texts.en: Osayomore is married with 5 children, she is 45 years old, she sells provision and foodstuff and has been in this business for years. She is requesting for the loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuff. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff and provision to sell.

loans.name: Believe

texts.en: Believe makes lovely hair for her clients in her salon.She also sells hair extensions.she hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell.She is a young and hard working woman.She is 31 years old and married with 2 children.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Isaack Oyugi

texts.en:
Isaack is married to Wilkister and they have no children yet.

The client has been in the Kerosene business for five years. He is also a trained teacher and with this profession he gets his secondary source of income. His business is situated in an area where most people use kerosene lamps and stoves for cooking. 

He was introduced to KADET by group member and he is now servicing his fifth loan in KADET. He has not been in arrears for all the loans we have advanced him. With the extra profit he will add stock in the grocery shop.

His future hopes are to be able to develop a piece of land he had bought a longtime ago.

Issack believes he is very hard working.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used to stock the kerosene pump with keresone for selling.

loans.name: Khan

texts.en: Khan S. is a widow woman and a 45 years old and resides in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia her birth place. Khan S. currently sells vegetables that she grows them on her own land in the village. Normally, Khan S. needs to wait three month times later before harvesting and selling her mature crop. She has five children: four are married and live independently and other one is single and works with her on the farm. Khan S. will be using the half of her loan to buy more vegetable seeds to grow. In addition, she will use the rest of the loan to order buy marble blocks to resell at gaining profit.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable seeds to grow

loans.name: Mrs. Thoeun Sau Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This group consists of eighteen people, all of whom live in Treapeang Phlu, a village in the Takeo province. Mrs. Thoeun S. is the group president; she was selected by the members. She is a Khmer cake seller. She is also a farmer who owns a piece of land, where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, unfortunately, the soil is infertile. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make the land more productive. Her husband, Mr. Sar Touch, is a construction worker. Mrs. Thoeun S. is 33 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. 

Seventeen members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: buying fertilizer

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha D. is 50 years old and is married to Perlito D.. They were given 2 children: Evelyn, 19 years old and in 2nd year college and Cristy, 17 years old and only graduated from high school because she cannot afford to go to college. Editha works hard because she wants her two children to finish their studies through college. If Editha cannot afford to send both of the girls to college, the older daughter has promised that, if ever she would finish her studies and get a job, she will send her younger sibling to college.

The main source of the family's income is their wood lamination business. In this business they develop a customer's photographs and then make wooden picture frames for them. An example is the graduation picture shown here. Since Editha became a member of Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she has always used the loans that she received from the institution to improve this business. The wood lamination business provides the family with their daily expenses and the expenses in school of the older child. The whole family works together to make this business run.

Editha dreams that their business continues to grow because it will bring a better life to their whole family.

loans.use: To finance a wood lamination and photography business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells bags of cement in retail to her customers in Sapele, Delta state, Nigeria.She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more bags of cement to sell. She is 46 years old and married with 6 children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cement to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthea Ork Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people who are all living in Niel village, Takeo province, make up the village bank loan. Mrs. Chanthea O. is a village bank president; she has been selected the members. They all will use the loan in different ways. She sells frogs and fish in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Rin Theara, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Now Mrs. Chanthea O. is asking for a loan to buy piglets, pig food, and fertilizer to support the rice field. She is 24 years old and the mother of a child who is too yoU. to wO. or study. 

Six members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy piglet, pig food, and fertilizer to support the rice field.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 34 years old and she is married with 4 children.She sells groceries to earn a living and also to satisfy the needs of her family.She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. she says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Uche

texts.en: Uche is 28 years old and married with 2 children. she sells clothes and shoes to make a living. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell.She says thanks to all kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un T., 49 years old, lives with her family members in the province of Pursat, Cambodia. Un T. and her husband are local farmers and they have four children. Two of them are married and have ready started new family homes, while the other two are attending school and under their control. This couple works hard everyday at their business activities: planting rice, fruit, and some vegetables from their village. They typically generate an average of $2 per day. To help meet their hard physical labors during the plowing process, Un T. is looking for a loan to buy a pair of oxen which she will use them to plow the farmland.

loans.use: To buy a pair of oxen which she will use them to plow the farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more  foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca sells cooked foods like rice, beans, moi-moi(steamed beans cake),fufu and drinks.She started this business in 2004.she hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.She is 55 years old and married with a child.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Vin's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vin P. is a group leader of six members who all live in Prech village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a fish middle woman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fishes to resell to earn more income. Mrs. Vin P. is 33 years old widow with a child who is attending the local school. 
Three members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: By purchasing more fishes to resell to earn more income.

loans.name: Idada

texts.en: A. is 49 years old and married with 7 children. She sells provisions and drinks. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting for the loan amount of N80000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Vannak T. is a group leader of four members who all live in Trapeang Srang village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow vegetables. She and her husband, Mr. Sam Phan, are musicians who have been hired by the people to play during wedding ceremony. Her husband is also a fisherman and now he needs more fishnets for his fishing. Thus, Mrs. Vannak T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband’s fishing. This couple has two children, one of whom is a fisherman while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband’s fishing.

loans.name: Idemudia

texts.en: I. is 48 years old and she is married with 5 children. She sells frozen food and has been in the business for more than 17 years.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more frozen food. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Onaghise

texts.en: A. sells hair extensions materials, provisions and clothes. She is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She has been in the business for long. She hopes for the loan amount of N120000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks  to sell

loans.name: Srorn

texts.en: Mrs. Srorn H. lives in Ta Norn village in Takeo province. She is a grocer and a weaver at home. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products and raw materials to improve her business. Her husband, Mr. Menh Chai Thav, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Srorn H. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in a local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: By purchasing more grocery products and raw materials to improve her business.

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina, a 50-year-old married mother of six children, sells groceries in her community in Sapele, Delta State, Nigeria. She is very determined to lift her business and family above poverty and hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Osaigbovo

texts.en: H. is 55years old and married with 7 children, She sells frozen food, foodstuff and provision. She lives in Benin City, Edo State. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more provisions and frozen food. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff and provision to sell

loans.name: Egharevba

texts.en: Q. sells fire woods. She is 50 years old and married with 7 children. She has been in the business for some years now. She hopes for the loan amount of N90000 purchase more fire wood to sells. She thanks all her kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fire woods  to sell

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Mr. Sarin H. lives in Koul village in Takeo province. He breeds ducks and pigs. Since his poultry business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing 250 more ducks for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Chan Sokha, uses the rice to make wine to sells to support her household. Mr. Sarin H. is 42 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is employed in a Casino club and the other is attending the local school. His wife is presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: By purchasing 250 more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen sells fried beef by hawking it within her community in Sapele, Delta State, Nigeria.  A hard-working woman, she purchases the beef in the market and then fries it  by herself to sell. Queen is 53 years old and married with 6 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more beef to fry and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more beef to fry and sell

loans.name: Obasuyi

texts.en: V.is 53years old and is married with 7 children. She sells cooked foods. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuff. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to cook and drinks to sell

loans.name: Nhean

texts.en: Mrs. Nhean P. is a villager in Pour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile soil which it is a bad to affect to her crops. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support the rice field. Mrs. Nhean P. is 63 years old widow with a child who is a construction worker.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support the rice field.

loans.name: Etaroghene

texts.en: B. is 44 years old and the married mother of four children. She sells wood and hopes for the loan amount of N120000 to purchase more wood to sell. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wood  to sell

loans.name: Rosália Armando

texts.pt:
Rosália T. é natural de Maputo tem 29 anos de idade é solteira não tem filhos vive numa casa alugada. Frequenta a escola, neste momento esta concluindo o ensino médio.

Ela trabalha na Educação como professora a mais de 5 anos das 7h as 12h todos os dias da semana e aufere 4.700.00mt que aplica no sustento da família e poupa algum dinheiro no banco comercial, Barclays.

Foi formada pelo Centro de formação de professores de Namaacha a 6 anos.
Com este empréstimo de 15.000.00mt pretende comprar material de construção, concretamente cimento, ferro, chapas de zinco e outros.

Nunca pediu empréstimos em outras instituições financeiras. Conheceu a Hluvuku pela Eva Nunes amiga dela e cliente da mesma instituição.
Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku sendo os anteriores de 10.200.00mt e 12.000.00mt. 
O seu grande desafio é terminar a Obra e viver na sua própria casa, para tal pretende pagar bem este empréstimo e pedir mais. No futuro gostaria de levantar créditos para conclusão da obra e compra de mobiliário.
texts.en:
Rosália T. is a native of Maputo. She is 29 years old, single, does not have children, and lives in a rented house. She goes to school and is currently finishing her secondary education. She has worked in education as a teacher for more than five years, from 7:00 a.m. to 12:00 noon every day of the week, and earns 4,700 MT which she uses for the support of her family, putting a little money aside in Barclays, the commercial bank. She graduated from the Teachers Training Centre of Namaacha six years ago. With this loan of 15,000 MT, she plans to purchase construction materials, specifically cement, iron, corrugated iron, and other things. She has never requested a loan from other financial institutions. She came to know about Hluvuku through Eva Nunes, a friend of hers and a client of this same institution. This is her third loan with Hluvuku, the previous ones being for 10,200 MT and 12,000 MT. Her great challenge is to finish construction and live in her own house, and for that she plans to pay this loan back and request another. In the future, she would like to raise loans to finish construction and purchase furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material (cement, corrugated iron and other materials)

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy, 33 years old and married, sells electrical goods such as microwaves, irons, etc.  She started this business in 2005 and now hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more electrical goods to sell.  She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical goods to sell

loans.name: Much

texts.en: Mrs. Much K. lives in Pour village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Meach Mous, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile soil which it is a bad to affect to his crops. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Much K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make the crops more productive. She is 58 years old and the mother of 58 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a tailor training while the others are farmers.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make the crops more productive.

loans.name: Kobilbobo

texts.en:
Kobilbobo is 56 years old and he makes a living buying and selling livestock. He's married with 4 children. Over the years, Kobilbobo has become very knowledgeable about what is required to raise cattle, their feeding, their calving, etc. It should be noted that, in the past, this man endured hard economic times for a while but he's managed to come through thanks to the help provided by IMON International. IMON International has granted loans that Kobilbobo has used to buy calves, the reason, too, that he needs this loan now. The loan will greatly improve Kobilbobo’s income and his family's living standards. 

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle

loans.name: Maria  Pedro

texts.pt:
Maria Pedro N. é natural de Xai- xai província de Gaza tem 44 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 4 filhos com 28, 24, 22 e 14 anos de idade. Os dois mais novos vão a escola. O seu marido trabalha na RSA (Republica da Africa do Sul) e, de vez enquanto, manda dinheiro para ajudar no sustento da família. Ela fez quarta classe parou de estudar quando foi ao lar. Vive na casa própria e para alem dos filhos não sustenta mais ninguém. 

Saiu de Xai xai a 29 anos atrás após o seu casamento. Devido a algumas dificuldades que ela passava, optou por iniciar um negocio próprio a mais de 24 anos. Vende mais capulanas que compra por 620.00mt a peça e vende a 800.00mt. No final de cada mes rende aprox. 8.000.00mt com o qual consegue poupar algum num dos Bancos comercias de Moçambique (Millenium Bim).

Já teve empréstimos no micro Banco Tchuma para comércio. Parou de levantar lá quando a vizinha aconselhou que a Hluvuku oferecia melhores oportunidades em termos de crédito.

Este é seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 10.000.00mt para comprar mais peças de capulanas para aumentar o volume negocio. O empréstimo passado foi também do mesmo valor e finalidade. 

Propor se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos para melhorar/ construir um estabelecimento convencional, para satisfazer a sua clientela e render mais dinheiro.
texts.en:
Maria Pedro N. is a native of Xai-xai in the province of Gaza. She is 44 years old, is married and the mother of four children aged 28, 24, 22 and 14 years. The two youngest go to school. Her husband works in RSA (Republic of South Africa) and, from time to time, sends money to help support the family. Maria finished fourth grade and stopped studying when she set up her own household. She lives in her own house and, apart from her children, is not responsible for supporting anyone. She left Xai-xai 29 years ago, after her marriage. Due to some difficulties that she encountered, she chose to begin her own business more than 24 years ago. She sells mostly capulanas (lengths of brightly-coloured cloth used as skirts, wraps, headdresses, etc.) which she buys for 620 MT apiece and sells for 800 MT. At the end of every month this brings in approximately 8,000 MT, from which she manages to put some aside in one of the commercial banks of Mozambique (Millenium Bim). She has already had business loans from the micro Bank Tchuma. She stopped raising money there when a neighbour advised her that Hluvuku offered better opportunities in credit limits. This is her second loan with Hluvuku-Adsema in the amount of 10,000 MT for purchasing more capulanas to increase the volume of her business. The last loan was for the same amount and purpose. She intends to repay the loan without any problem, in order to be able to access more loans to improve and construct a conventional business establishment to satisfy her customers and bring in more money.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of capulanas (women's clothing)

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty, 32 years old and single, has a salon where she sells hair cream and hair extensions. She also creates lovely hair styles for her customers. Beauty hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Since she was a small girl, Gulnora has been entirely dedicated to work. She buys and sells sheep. Until now this has been the most important source of income for her. Her work consists of raising sheep and, after fattening them, she sells them at the best price and makes her profit. In the future she wants to start another business. In the meantime she will continue dedicating herself to sheep raising. Right now she wishes to expand her business and purchase more sheep. That is the reason that Gulnora asked for a loan of 4500 Somoni. You could become an important part in Gulnora family's life, she deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand a sheep business

loans.name: Mario Eduardo

texts.pt:
Mário Eduardo de Benjamim L., natural de Tete, província de Tete, tem 39 anos de idade, casado e pai de 02 filhos com 07 e 01 anos de idade, o primeiro vai a escola. Fez o nível médio no ensino técnico profissional, parou de estudar porque não conseguiu ingressar no ensino superior. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem da esposa e dos filhos.

Em 2002 saiu de Tete para Maputo junto com a sua família quando foi transferido pelos serviços. É funcionário público e faz 08 horas diárias, foi formado pela CIDOC (Instituto Médio de Ciências Documentais – Fundo bibliográfico da língua portuguesa) a 07 anos, aufere um salário mensal de 15.365,92mt com o qual sustenta a família e consegue poupar para melhorar a sua habitação.

Conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que são clientes da mesma, já trabalhou com o banco Barclays, não se recorda do valor mas foi para construção. 

Com o empréstimo de 15.000,00mt pretende comprar areia, pedra e cimento para concluir a sua obra. Compromete-se a pagar bem para poder aceder a novos empréstimos para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Mário Eduardo de Benjamim L. is from the Tete province. He is 39 years old, married and father of two children. His children are 7 and 1 years old, and the first one goes to school. Mário did high school at a professional school, but stopped his studies because he could not enter university. He lives in his own house and does not economically support anyone else beyond his wife and his two children. In 2002, he left Tete to Maputo with his family when he was transferred at this job. He works for government and does 08 hours/day. He graduated at CIDOC (High Institute of Sciences - Bibliographic Fund of Portuguese Language) 07 years ago. His monthly salary is 15,365.92 MZN with which he supports his family and saves to improve his house., He learnt about Hluvuku through his friends who are Hluvuku’s clients. He has worked with the bank Barclays. He doesn’t remember the value but it was used for construction. With the 15,000 MZN loan he intends to buy sand, stone, and cement in order to conclude his construction. He pledges to pay back well so that to have access to new loans in order to furnish his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials (cement, sand and others)

loans.name: Jaime Oneasse

texts.pt:
Jaime Oniasse B. nasceu em Homoine, província de Inhambane, tem 28 anos de idade, casado e pai de 03 filhos de 07, 05 e 01 anos de idade, os primeiros dois vão a escola, estudou ate 9ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Homoine com 15 anos de idade quando os pais foram transferidos pelos serviços.
Trabalha como segurança permanente na SSP (empresa de segurança) a 3 anos e aufere um salário de 2.800.00mt por mes. Consegue poupar algum no Banco Barclays.

Para alem de estar a trabalhar, também faz actividade comercial (venda de peixe e frango congelado) onde obtém um rendimento diário de aprox. 350.00mt. Estes produtos compra a 1.150.00 para o peixe e vende a 1.500.00mt e o frango por 750.00mt a compra e vende por 1.000.00mt.  

Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt, com o qual pretende adquirir mais peixe, frango e outros como forma de satisfazer a demanda de seus clientes e aumento do seu rendimento. 

Conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que são clientes da mesma e nunca pediu credito em outras instituições financeiras, assim pretende pagar bem sem problemas, para pedir mais empréstimos.

No futuro gostaria de fazer crescer o seu negócio e colocar a sua casa em melhores condições.
texts.en:
Jaime Oniasse B. was born in Homoine, in the province of Inhambane, he is 28 years old, married and has 3 children who are 7, 5 and 1 years old, the first two go to school. Jaime studied until the 9th grade when he had to stop because of lack of financial resources. He lives in his own house and doesn't supports relatives just his family. He left Homoine when he was 15 years old when his parents were transferred. He works as a security guard permanently at SSP (a security company) for the last 3 years and gets a salary of 2.800MT a month. He is able to save some at Barclays bank. Besides working, he also sells fish and frozen chickens and obtains a daily profit of 350MT approximately. He buys the fish at 1,150 and sells at 1,500MT and he buys the chicken at 750MT and sells it at 1,000MT. This is his first loan for 10,000MT which he wants to use to buy more fish, chicken and other products to satisfy his client's needs and increase his profit. He learned about Hluvuku from his neighbors who are clients, he never requested loans at other financial institutions and he expects to pay without problems and request new loans. In the future he would like to grow his business and improve his house's conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell fish and chickens

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
B. Alisher is an ordinary man in the city of Khujand in Tajikistan. He is a very responsible person that since his youth has been running a livestock farm with the goal of supporting his family, his wife and three children. Alisher needs to purchase calves to reproduce them and maximize his profits by selling their milk and meats. Once that he has these products from his flock he sells them in his neighborhood and in this manner he is able to support his family. For this reason, Alisher is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
