Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience sells cooked foods and drinks.She has been in this business for long.She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers.she is 50 years old and married with 7 children.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Adelaide Luis

texts.pt:
Adelaide C. é natural de Maputo, tem 37 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 13 e 6 anos de idade. Fez 7ª classe, parou com os seus estudos devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com os filhos e sem ninguém mais por sustentar. 

Nunca mudou de residência, vive de comércio já a 10 anos e é dona do próprio negocio. Vende mais refrigerantes e outros produtos de mercearia. Para os refrigerantes o valor de compra é de 240.00mt e 340.00mt venda e mercearia 1.100.00mt na compra e vende a 1.500.00mt. obtém aprox. 1.500.00mt diários provenientes das vendas.

Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com o qual pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria comprando mais refrigerantes e produtos de mercearia. Ela conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinha que também já é cliente a longa data nunca havia levantado créditos em outras instituições.

Tem como objectivo ampliar o seu negócio através de pedido de mais empréstimos para a aquisição de um congelador como forma de satisfazer as necessidades dos clientes.
texts.en:
Adelaide C. was born in Maputo, she is 37 years old, single and mother of two children who are 13 and 6 years old. She studied until the 7th grade, she had to stop when she got pregnant. She lives at her own home and doesn't support relatives, just her family. She never moved from her home, and has been working in commerce for the past 10 years and owns her own business. She sells soft dirnks and groceries. She buys soft drinks at 240MT and sells them at 340MT, and she buys the groceries at 1,100MT and sells them at 1,500MT she gets a profit of approximately 1,500MT from her sales. This is her first loan at Hluvuku for 10,000MT, which she expects to use to increase the volume of her merchandise buying more drinks and groceries. She learned about Hluvuku from a neighbor who is a long time client. She has never requested credit at another institutions. She expect to increase her business requesting more loans to get a freezer in order to satisfy her client's needs.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell soft drinks and groceries

loans.name: Adozinda Leonor

texts.pt:
Adozinda Leonor Xirinda é natural de Maputo tem 44 anos de idade solteira mãe de 3 filhos gémeos de 22 anos e outro de 19 anos todos estudam. Fez o nível médio de magistério primário (instituto de magistérios primários da Matola) Vive na casa dos serviços junto com os seus filhos.

Adozinda nunca mudou de cidade, é professora e trabalha das 07.00h as 17.00h auferindo um salário mensal de 5.440.00mt. que aplica no sustento da família e construção da sua casa própria em fases.
 
Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000.00mt pretende comprar blocos, cimento areia e chapas para a sua obra. Sendo este o terceiro empréstimo os anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt e 10.500.00mt todos para a mesma actividade. 

Já teve alguns empréstimos com Tchuma, uma instituição de crédito. Quando as amigas lhe disseram que haviam abandonado para se juntarem a Hluvuku, por varias razoes, ela também preferiu seguir o mesmo caminho.

Os desafios que enfrentam é a subida dos preços de material, mas como o objectivo dela é concluir a sua obra ira pagar bem este empréstimo assim para levantar mais no futuro e continuar com os estudos.
texts.en:
Adozinda Leonor Xirinda was born in Maputo, she is 44 years old, single and has 3 children, twins who are 22 years old, and another who is 19 years old, all of them are studying. She finished the mid level of elementary teaching (at the Elementary education Institute in Matola) she lives at the service houses with her children. Adozinda never moved from her city, she is a teacher and works from 7am to 5pm and earns a monthly salary of 5,440MT which she uses to support her family and to build her own house in phases. With the current loan of 10,000MT she expects to buy bricks, cement, sand and metal sheets for the construction. This is her third loan the previous ones were for 10,000MT and 10,500MT for the same activity. She already had some loans with Tchuma, a credit institution. When her friends told her about Hluvuku she followed them. Her current challenge is the high prices of construction materials, but her goal is to finish the construction so she will pay well the loan in order to request more in the future to finish her studies.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, sand, and others)

loans.name: Ofugho

texts.en: Ofugho is a 30 year old married woman with a child.She has been working as a commercial-based tailor since 2004 to earn income to satisfy the needs of her child and husband.She is requesting for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase tailoring materials to meet the requirement of her customers and make good income.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Ayola

texts.en: Y., a 34-year-old married mother of one child, has been a caterer for the past four years. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more flour and decoration materials. Y. says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more decoration materials

loans.name: Women Of God Group

texts.en:
Women of God is a group of five borrowers led by Eva M., a single 20-year-old woman who has thus far achieved an 11th grade education. She lives with her parents in Virginia, a newly built community for poor people who can't afford to buy  town lots north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia.

Eva's business is selling foodstuffs such as onion, pepper, milk, salt, garden eggs, etc. She buys them wholesale and retails them in the Dualla market, north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia. In business for two years now, she hopes to develop the enterprise to the point where she can eventually open a shop.

Because Eva depends on her business to pay for her school fees and her daily needs, she places a premium on developing and maintaining a good relationship with her customers to encourage them to continue buying from her.  Payment of her school fees reduces her business capital and savings, so she needs this loan in order to purchase more foodstuffs in order to improve business.

Eva dreams of improving her living standard and continuing her education to the highest level.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs in order to improve the business.

loans.name: Valdemira Gaspar

texts.pt:
Valdemira L. nasceu na localidade de Canda Distrito de Zavala na Província de Inhambane tem 41 anos de idade é mãe solteira de uma filha de 13 anos de idade que frequenta 9ª classe na Escola Secundaria Zedequias Manganhela.

Vive em khongolote, um dos Bairros periféricos da cidade de Maputo, com a sua filha na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém. Fez 7ª classe do antigo sistema e não foi possível continuar devido as dificuldades financeiras por parte dos progenitores.

Saiu de Zavala rumo a Maputo a convite de seu irmão mais velho, actualmente trabalha como empregada doméstica em regime temporário a mais de 6 anos onde faz cerca de 10 horas por dia. Aprendeu esta actividade de suas irmãs, quando nova. No trabalho que faz, aufere 2.000.00mt por mês onde poupa algum através de sistema de poupança tradicional (Xitique)

Nunca havia solicitado nenhum empréstimo em outras instituições de créditos.
Este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar cimento, areia mão-de-obra e outros. Os valores anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt ambos para a mesma actividade.

Com este empréstimo espera melhorar a sua residência, memo enfrentando o problema de alto custo de materiais de construção, no futuro pretende pedir mais crédito para a compra de bens de consumo e conclusão da sua obra.
texts.en:
Valdemira L. was born in the Canda District of Zavala in the province of Inhambane. She is 41 years old and a single mother of a 13 year old girl who attends 9th grade at the Zedequias Manganhela secondary school. She lives with her daughter in a home she owns in Khongolote, a suburban area outside of the city of Maputo. She does not support anyone else. She attended school until 7th grade in the old system, but was unable to continue due to her parents' financial difficulties. She left Zavala for Maputo at the invitation of her oldest brother. She has been a domestic worker without a fixed contract for more than 6 years, working around 10 hours per day. She learned to do this work from her sisters, when she was young. She earns 2.000.00 MT per month and saves a bit through the traditional savings system (Xitique). She has never requested a loan from any other lending institution. This is her third loan with Hluvuku, for the amount of 10.000.00 MT which she will use to purchase cement, sand, labor, etc. Her previous loans were for 10.000.00 MT and 15.000.00 MT, both for the same purpose. With this loan she plans to make improvements to her home, even with the problem of the high cost of construction materials. In the future she plans to request additional loans to purchase consumer goods and to finish construction.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en:
S. Ismoil is 26 years old. He is married with three children. Since he was a very young he has been in the business of raising and selling cattle which is why he has a lot of experience. It is necessary to point out that he has been able to succeed thanks to the support provided by IMON International. This support has been in the form of a loan which he has used to purchase and raise young bulls in their locality. Today, Ismoil has once again come to IMON International for a loan which will allow him to purchase young bulls to raise and sell. It is his biggest dream to improve the conditions of his business in order to then improve the conditions of his family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the young cattle

loans.name: Ehizonomen

texts.en: G. is 34 years old and single. He sells fish which he buys in cartons from cold rooms. He buys them from Benin Lagos and Port Harcourt. He is requesting for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more cartons of fish to sell. He thanks you for the loans

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells text books to make a living.she hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more text books to sell.Her ultimate goal is to lift her business and family above poverty.She is 50 years old and married with 6 children.She says a big thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more text books to sell

loans.name: Kenjaboy

texts.en:
D. Kenjaboy is 41 years old. He is married with 4 children. His wife is the housekeeper. For more than 15 years he is running the small café where he is cooking national dishes. The business generates the stable income for supporting his family and improving the living conditions. Today Kenjaboy requests $800 US Dollars. He is planning purchasing of inventory like plates and dishes, tables and chairs to expand his business and to improve the conditions of his small café for the clients. Kenjaboy would like to thank everyone for support.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new chairs and tables for expanding his cafe

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is 28 years old and she is single without a child.She sells sarongs of various colours.She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Kenjaboy

texts.en: T. Kenjaboy is from the city of Khujand, Tajikistan. Currently, he dedicates himself to his livestock business, a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the community. He is the father of two children who he cares for and has the responsibility of educating. It’s important to note that Kenjaboy is very conscious of his duty to support his family financially. It’s for this reason that he turned to IMON International to obtain a loan to purchase some young cattle to help him increase his income. With your help, Kenjaboy will be able to make his business succeed and support his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: To buy some calves to increase his income

loans.name: God Of Abraham Group

texts.en:
God of Abraham Group is a group of five borrowers led by Hawa K..

Hawa is 36 years old and is married with two children aged 3 and 22 years old, with educational levels of nursery through 6th grade. Hawa is illiterate due to early childbirth during her youth. She lives with her parents in Virginia, a newly built community for poor people who can't afford to buy a town lot. It is situated north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Hawa's business is selling food stuffs like tomatoes, peppers, oil, salt, garden eggs (eggplant), etc. She buys them wholesale and sells retail in the Dualla market. She has been running this business for five years and hopes to grow her business into a shop in the future.

Because Hawa depends on her business to pay her children’s school fees and supply their daily needs, she talks to her customers with a good manner and always offers her customers plastic bags when they purchase from her in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Whenever Hawa credits her customers it can be difficult to collect her money, which reduces the capital of her business and savings. Therefore, she needs this loan in order to purchase more goods in order to improve her business.

Hawa dreams of improving her and her family’s living standard and giving her children a better education.

loans.use: To buy more goods to improve her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more stock for various products

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is 38 years old and married with two children. She sells foodstuffs such as rice and cooking oil. She is requesting the loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Margret's ultimate goal for her business is to make more profits. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Small fish

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is 60 years old and married with eight children. She sells ice fish and has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more ice fish to sell. Margret is a hardworking woman and very energetic. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice fish to sell

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en:
United Women is a group of five borrowers led by Beatrice C., a 44-year-old single mother of four children. Her children are aged between 23 and 27 years old and have attained education from 12th grade up to university senior. Beatrice also cares for four grandchildren. Beatrice dropped out of school in 6th grade due to poverty. She and her family live in Virginia, a newly-built community north of the capital, Monrovia, for poor people who can't afford to buy a town lot.

Beatrice's business is selling fish. She buys fish wholesale from fishermen and sells it retail to residents of Virginia. She has been running this business for 27 years and hopes to establish a fish wholesale depot in the future. Beatrice talks to her customers in a good manner and sells good, fresh fish, in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. Beatrice dreams of giving her grandchildren a good education as preparation for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Esther Wamuyu

texts.en:
Esther Wamuyu is a married lady of 43 years old with one child. 

She runs a retail shop at Kangemi center in Nairobi and she has been in the business for a period of about two years. Her clients are mainly from kangemi where her shop is. 

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a member and this will be her first loan and she has never taken any from other MFIs. She intends to buy diffent products for her store. With the extra profit she hopes to finish developing her plot and move her business there as she rents the other rooms in order to improve her living standards.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add stock of different products

loans.name: Arinze

texts.en: Arinze N. is 45 years old and married with five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells foodstuffs and drinks and is requesting the loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She sends her thanks to Kiva lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is a 30-year-old married woman who has two school-aged children. She runs a grocery shop at Kangemi market, which is busy and popular with middle and low income earners. Mary has been running the business for seven years and makes a profit of about 32,000 KES. She has never borrowed from another financial institution, and was introduced to KADET by a neighbour who is also a member. Mary wants to use her loan to buy more stock and diversify into selling cereals and onions besides fresh fruit. Mary hopes to expand her business to increase her cash flow and, in the future, buy her own land.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy cereals and onions to add to her fruit business

loans.name: Elizabeth Wanjiru

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old and married with two children. She is a poultry farmer, and has been in this business for about four years. She makes a profit of approximately 250,000 KES.

Elizabeth was introduced to KADET by friends who are also members. She wants to use her loan to buy more chicks so as to meet the demands of her customers who are located in the Njiku area of Kikuyu. Elizabeth hopes to operate a wholesale business for eggs and chicken supplies, and one day have a large poultry farm that will enable her to compete with other existing farms.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more chicks for her poultry farm

loans.name: Mokwe

texts.en: L. is 28 years old and married with 5 children. She is a tailor and has been in the business for the past 6 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N70000 to purchase more bags, shoes and clothes to sell. She thanks all her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags, shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Jesus Loves You Group

texts.en:
Jesus Loves You is a group of five borrowers led by Irantatie P., a 50-year-old married woman with five children. Her children are aged beween 26 and 32 years old and have attained education from 9th grade to university graduate. Irantatie herself is illiterate due to poverty. She and her family live in Virginia, a newly-built community north of the capital, Monrovia, for poor people who can't afford to buy a town lot.

Irantatie's business is selling charcoal and palm oil. She buys these wholesale from farmers in rural Liberia and sells them retail to residents of Virginia. She has been running this business for 30 years and hopes to expand it. Irantatie sells good quality palm oil and charcoal and talks to her customers in a courteous manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and charcoal. Irantatie dreams that she and her family will be successful.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil and charcoal

loans.name: Nwosu

texts.en: Nwosu is 30 years old and married with three children. She sells groceries to make a living and this is her main source of income. She is requesting the loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Victoria” esta representado por la señora Mariela y conformada por 12 miembros, todos radican en la misma zona en la comunidad la Victoria D. donD. proviene su nombre,  esta comunidad se encuentra alejada del centro D. la ciudad donD. la mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la producción D. papa, lechuga, hortalizas y a la elaboración D. pan casero.  En cuanto a la competencia  esta muy elevada pero como su producto D. panificación es muy conocido ellas tienen buenas ventas ya que su producto es muy aceptado por la población a pesar del alza D. precios. El destino del crédito es para el incremento D. insumos para las panaderías y para compra D. semillas para la agricultura en algunos casos para la compra D. amasadoras y mezcladoras automáticas para incrementar mas sus ventas ya que en esta época del año las ventas son mas elevadas y se  esperan que sus negocios  crezcan y obtengan un mayor beneficios para darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. A pesar D. ser su primer crédito las socias tienen experiencia en créditos solidarios debido a financiamientos en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.en:
Epifanio is 68 years old, and is married to Ernesta, a retired teacher. They have two grown children who are married and have their own homes. Ever since Epifiano was little he was devoted to shoes, a profession he learned from his father. When he was 22 he married his wife and they decided to engage in commerce by setting up a small grocery business at home. 
Today his grocery store is run by his daughter while he manages his shoe business. He is using his loan to buy leather soles and glue, which are materials used in his line of work for making footwear.

loans.use: Leather Soles and Glue for footwear

loans.name: Iluciones Group

texts.es: El grupo “Ilusiones” esta representado por la señora Dora y conformada por 13 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican al comercio D. ropa, zapatos, artesanías, abarrotes en  tiendas D. barrio, joyas D. plata y adornos para todo tipo D. fiestas. Todas las socias radican en el mismo barrio por lo que no existe mucha competencia ya que la mayoría venden diferentes productos y además poseen puestos ya bien establecidos. El destino del crédito es para incremento D. capital y la adquisición D. materiales e insumos para mejorar y agrandar a sus negocios obteniendo mejores ganancias para darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. El grupo ya va cumpliendo su segundo ciclo con la institución en el cual demostraron capacidad, responsabilidad, honestidad y sobre todo unión  por lo que la fundación Agrocapital vuelve a otorgarles un apoyo económico para que sigan creciendo y trabajando juntos.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys, 37, is married to Tiburcio, 48, and they have two sons, aged 8 and 10. Every morning, Gladys gets up at 4 a.m., does her chores, and then goes to sell sporting goods. Gladys has been in this line of business for several years now. Thanks to her efforts and sacrifice, she has been able to send her two children to school in addition to buying her own home. Gladys is pleased with her work and now wants to purchase more merchandise, such as shirts and shorts, to offer her customers a wider range of goods.

loans.use: To purchase more goods, such as shirts and shorts

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 27 years old and she is married with 5 children. She sells provisions to make a living and she is doing well in her business.she hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more provisions to sell.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Erabor

texts.en: A. is 46 years old and married with seven children. She sells provisions and has been in this business for years. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old and lives with Maria. They have 1 child together and they live in a neighborhood that is very close to the center of the city of Ita.
Juan has run a machine shop out of his home for 9 years. He replaces spare parts for vehicles or taxis, private or casual. He says he is pleased with the profits because it helps his family’s welfare. 
Juan wants to take out a loan to buy petrol engines, so he can resell it and generate extra family income.

loans.use: Petrol Engines

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: P. owns a phone booth. She is 22 years old and single. She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more phone rechargeable cards and Sims cards of all networks to sell. She thanks all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more phone rechargeable cards and Sims cards of all networks

loans.name: Endurance

texts.en:
Endurance is 28 years old, and she sells cooked foods and beverages. Specifically, Endurance sells foods such as moi-moi (a steamed beans cake), pepper soup, and banga soup.

At present, she is hoping to expand her business. Therefore, she is seeking a loan in the amount of N80,000 ($550) in order to purchase more foodstuffs to cook (and then sell for a profit). She expresses her deep gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lydia is 64 years old and is a single mother of 5 children. The oldest daughter, Jorgelina, is 43 years old and is working in Buenos Aires. Her second oldest, Maria Cristina, is 41 years old and is employed and living in Nemby. Celia is 34 years of age and Ever is 31, and they are working in Spain. Arther is the youngest son and he is working with his mother to sell drinks. 
Lidia began her business 4 years ago and requests a loan to buy more drinks. With the loan, they can increase the stock of their goods and thus their income. In addition to earnings that are generated from the business, it also gives financial support to all of her children, especially those who are working abroad. Her greatest wish is that they can all be together again.

loans.use: Drinks

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. Her children are between the ages of 12 and 20, and they are all attending school at the present time. In addition, Mary cares for additional family members. She resides in and rents a two-room house, where she lives with six other people. Her family has access to electricity but no running water, and she works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala.

For ten years, Mary has been in the business of selling bananas in the Kalerwe market. She notes that she purchases these bananas from delivery trucks, which have been stocked by farmers. She explains that she does not incur any transportation costs to and from shopping areas because she buys the bananas at her place of work. She sells to all categories of people -- both retail and wholesale customers.

Mary has been with MCDT for nine years, and she is currently servicing her 22nd loan, working all the while with the same group members. She is now applying for another loan, with the hope that the proceeds from this loan could be used to buy additional bunches of bananas. She aspires to see her business expand further so that she can someday purchase her bananas directly from the farmers.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional bananas

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 35 years old, and she is married with four children.  To earn a living, she operates a general store, where she sells goods such as candles, beverages, sugar, and detergents.  She is now seeking a loan in the amount of N80,000 ($550) in order to purchase more provisions for resale purposes.  She expresses her deep gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional provisions

loans.name: Swagila Nalinya Group

texts.en:
Swagila is a 31-year-old married mother of four. Her children are between 9 and 16 years old. They all attend school. Swagila resides in a rented two-room house where she lives with six people. The family has access to electricity but has no piped water. They live and work in a suburb of Kampala. Swagila takes care of additional family members. 

Swagila earns her income by selling secondhand clothes in Najjanankumbi, Stella Zone. She buys these clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. She sells her wares both retail and wholesale to all kinds of people. Swagila has operated this business for ten years and has taken thirteen loans from MCDT over 8 years as a member of the same loan group. Swagila wants to use this loan to buy additional clothes. She aspires to see her business grow and wants to start importing goods directly from the United Kingdom.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino is 43 years old and lives with his partner Marcelina, who is 40. They have three children, who are ages 17, 19, and 20. Marcelino operates a grocery store from his house, but has to work away from the home as well in order to meet the needs of his family. The grocery store is therefore attended to by a partner, while Marcelino and his children go out and sell over-the-counter medicines.

Marcelino is very proud of his family’s efforts. They have managed to obtain many benefits for his home such as a TV, a refrigerator, sound equipment, and other appliances. With this loan he wants to purchase goods such as flour, rice, noodles, sugar, bread, and the like.

loans.use: To buy goods such as flour, rice, noodles, sugar, bread, and the like.

loans.name: Sarah Nabukenya Group

texts.en: Sarah is 37 year married with four children aged between 4 and 17 years .All her children go to school .She resiseds and owns  a two roomed house where she stays with four peopleThe family has access to electricity and no piped water and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala. Sarah Doesn’t take care of additional family members. Sarah sells beers in Ndeeba Kabowa Zone and buys crates of beer from delivery trucks.  She doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from shopping. She sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale Sarah has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for eight years servicing her thirteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy morecrates of beer. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a fully stocked bar.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 50-year-old single mother of four children who all go to school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she lives with six people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.

Gladys works in semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells secondhand clothes and buys these clothes from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. She doesn’t pay rent for her business as she sells from door to door. She sells to all categories of people both in retail and wholesale.

Gladys has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for five years, and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Oviawe

texts.en: E. is married with 2 children and she is 37years old.  She sells baby things for the past 9years. She has been with LAPO Microfinance for the past 6years. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more babythings. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more babythings to sell.

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es: El banco comunal  “Espíritu Santo” esta representado por la señora Karim y conformado por 12 miembros del mismo barrio y con el mismo entusiasmo para salir adelante. Los socios cuentan con diferentes actividades económicas entre las que podemos mencionar a propietarias D. farmacias, vendedoras D. productos como ser comida, abarrotes en  tiendas D. barrio, cosméticos, elaboración D. muebles D. madera y al servio D. transporte público D. pasajeros. Sus negocios se encuentran en diferentes lugares como también son ambulantes, por lo que sus negocios les son muy rentables y la competencia es escasa. Una mayoría D. los socios destinará el crédito en la inversión D. sus puestos D. venta  en agrandar sus negocios con la compra D. más mercadería o insumos para agrandar su venta D. comida para ello necesitaran dedicarse más al negocio y establecerse mejor generando mayores ingresos para brindar una mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los socios van

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 46 years old and lives with Melanio, who is 48 years of age. They have four children, two of whom are already grown and living in their own homes, and two who are still of school age.

Mercedes began working as a trader in the street, like her mother before her, and over time saved enough money to have a place in the market in the city of Ita, where she can sell fruit and vegetables from Monday to Sunday. The business has been quite profitable, so her husband and she decided to open a small grocery store in their home. After much sacrifice, they finally have two businesses.

They have been receiving loans from Fundacion Paraguay since 2005, and their enterprises are progressing quite well. This time they are applying for a loan to purchase fruits, vegetables, cassava, oil, and other goods to make their businesses even better.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables, cassava, oil, etc.

loans.name: Angels Of God Group

texts.en:
Angels of God Group is a group of five borrowers led by Hawa G..

Hawa  is 46 years old and is married with four children aged 15 to 24 years old with educational levels of 8th grade through university student. Hawa is illiterate due to poverty. She and her family live in Virginia, a newly built community for poor people who can't afford to buy a town lot. It’s situated north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Hawa's business is selling charcoal. She buys charcoal wholesale and sells retail to the residents of Virginia. She has been running this business for five years and is hoping to establish a shop in the future. Her business is what she and her family depends on for their daily needs because her husband's salary is very low. Hawa sells good charcoal and talks to her customers with a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Hawa needs this loan in order to purchase more charcoal to sell. She dreams of improving the living conditions of herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Oghoye

texts.en: I. is 54 years old and married with 6 children. He is farmer and has been in this business for years.  He is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to cultive his farm. He says thank you to all kiva lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant.

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es: El grupo "San Martín" esta representado por el señor Luis Fernando y conformado por 13 miembros de bajos ingresos muy trabajadoras y con expectativas de lograr mas ingresos. Las señoras tienen una amistad desde hace mucho tiempo conociéndose en sus actividades comerciales y como vecinas del barrio. Desempeñan diferentes tipos de actividades comerciales como tienda de abarrotes, venta de pan, pastillas, celulares, zapatos, cosméticos  y a la elaboración de prendas de vestir ya sea en puestos fijos o ambulantes.  En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes las socias tienen la facilidad de mover sus puestos y diversificar su mercadería para poder obtener así un ingreso diario para el sustento de sus familias. El destino del crédito es para invertir en mercadería, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a mejorar los ingresos diarios como por ejemplo la adquisición de un maquina de coser eléctrica que ayudaría mucho a doña Silvia para entregar trabajos mas rápidos y mejorar cada día mas los ingresos para sustentar a sus hijos y poderles dar todo lo que ella siempre soñó, una mejor educación y un futuro mejor para toda su familia. En cuanto a sus experiencias crediticias las socias van cursando ya su cuarto ciclo demostrando muchas ganas de seguir creciendo y honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Luis Fernando represents the San Martin Group. The group is comprised of 13 members with low incomes. They are very hard-working and have the expectation of achieving more income. The women have had a friendship for a long time; they know each other through their businesses and as neighbors. They work in different types of commercial activities like a grocery store, selling bread, cakes, cell phones, shoes, cosmetics, and making articles of clothing. Some have fixed stands and others are street vendors. If they have competitors, the members have the ability to move their stands and to diversity their merchandise to be able to get a daily income to support their families. The loan is to buy merchandise, supplies, and tools to help them improve their daily income. For example, getting an electric sewing machine would really help Silvie to deliver her work more quickly. This would improve her daily income to support her children. She would be able to give them everything she always dreamed about, a better education and a better future for the whole family. As far as their loan experience goes, the members are in their fourth cycle. They show a great desire to keep growing, honesty, and responsibility in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy and sell spare parts

loans.name: Emprendedora Group

texts.es: El grupo “Emprendedora” esta representada por la señora Tatiana y conformadas por 12 miembros de personas muy alegres y sus edades varían desde 23 hasta 60 años que en su mayoría son personas responsables con criterio formados así como también  son madres de familia. La presidenta se dedica a la venta de comida y el resto del grupo se dedica a actividades como venta de ropa, venta de abarrote en tiendas de barrio, cerveza, venta de pastillas y empanadas al paso. Existe mucha competencia en varias actividades como en la  venta de comida pero las socias tienen la ventaja de su experiencia y su sazón, aveces esto no es suficiente ya que la competencia siempre cuenta con mas capital de trabajo y con mejor servicio es por esta razón que las socias requieren el préstamo para hacerle frente a la competencia con productos de mejor calidad y mas atractivos para su venta. La experiencia de los miembros del grupo es escasa pero son gente responsable y con ganas de trabajar para sacar adelante a sus familias.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu, a 50-year-old widow with four children between the ages of 16 and 26, three of whom attend school, owns a two-roomed house where she resides with six people The family has access to electricity but no piped water and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.

Nulu buys threads and other knitting materials from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Uganda, and sells sweaters in Makerere Kikoni. While she incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping, she doesn’t pay rent for her business as she works from her home. In this business for ten years, Nulu both retails and wholesales her products. She has dealt with MCDT for the same length of time and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more knitting materials, her ultimate goals being expansion of her business and ownership of a sweater factory

loans.use: To buy more threads and other materials for sweater-making

loans.name: Igbineweka

texts.en: O. is 40 years old and married with 2 children. He is a farmer and  he has been in the farming business for the past 23 years. He hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more seedlings to plant and to cultivate his farm. He says thank you to all kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Nwachukwu

texts.en:
V. is married with a child and is 35 years old. She sells sarongs and has been in this business for the past six years. She uses the profit from her trade to assist her husband.

V. hopes for the loan of N50,000, to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Hauyacan Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Hauyacan” esta representado por la señora Evelyn  y conformado por 12 miembros muy unido y organizado en sus reuniones responsables en el horario y en sus cuotas. La presidenta tiene como actividad venta D. cotillo y venta D. tortas, lo realiza en su domicilio y los cotillones entrega pedidos es madre D. 2 hijos que estudian en el colegio, la señora Jacinta Q. tesorera del banco comunal tiene 7 hijos que estudian en el colegio, ella tiene como actividad la venta D. pan en su domicilio y el resto D. los miembros del grupo tienen actividades como la atención en puntos D. llamaD., venta D. comiD., atención en bazar, servicio D. limpieza y otras actividades comerciales D. venta D. productos. La competencia hoy en día se ve más en otros años pero lo importante es que ellas tiene clientes fijos y ellas siempre cumplen al pedido D. sus clientes, además tratan D. vender su producto a un menor precio y minimizan sus costos y  generar una ganancia razonable para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del crédito es para comprar materiales para realizar su cotillón, compra D. harina y otros insumos para la elaboración D. sus productos y compra D. material para agrandar sus negocios como comprar tarjetas D. crédito al por mayor. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los socios ya tienen experiencia en grupos comunales gracias a créditos similares en otras instituciones por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo y saben como administrar bien los fondos otorgados.
texts.en:
The Hauyacan Communal Bank is represented by Evelyn and is comprised of twelve members. They are very united and organized in their meetings. They are responsible about the schedule and in their payments. The president sells decorations and cakes in her home. She delivers the ordered decorations. She has two children who go to school. Jacinta is the treasurer of the Communal Bank. She has seven children who go to school. She sells bread in her home. The rest of the members have activities like call centers, food sales, working in a bazaar, cleaning services, and other commercial activities selling products. There is more competition these days, but the important thing is that they have regular customers, and they always fill their customers’ orders. Also, they try to sell their products at a lower price and minimize their costs to generate reasonable earnings to support their families. The loan is to buy materials to make decorations, to buy flour and other supplies to make their products, and to buy materials like wholesale credit cards to expand their businesses. As far as their credit experience goes, the members have experience in communal groups thanks to similar loans in other institutions. They know the type of work and how to do a good job of administering the given funds.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Eze

texts.en: M. makes shoe and bag to sell. He has been in this business for the past 7 years.  He is 42 years old and married with 4 children.  He is requesting for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more materials for making shoes and bag. He says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for making shoe and bag to sell.

loans.name: Las Escogidas 1, 2, & 3 Group

texts.en:
Gina is a 45-year-old borrower from Batey Alegria, a small community outside San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. Gina is a coordinator for her group, Las Escogidas (The Chosen), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group.

Gina lives with three of her six children. Her oldest children work in exporting, transportation, and woodworking, and her youngest children are currently in school. Gina lives in a batey, a rural community built by sugar companies for their workers. Gina and her family have a difficult life – little access to electricity, no running water or medical services, and insufficient roads. Bateyes are filled with some of the poorest people in not just the Dominican Republic, but the entire Western Hemisphere.

Despite these difficulties, Gina runs a successful pica pollo, or fried chicken stand. Pica pollo is one of the most popular foods in the Dominican Republic, and Gina knows she will always have a demand for her product. With her loan, Gina plans to buy and raise young chickens, as well as buying other foods such as rice, plantains, bananas, and juices.

Gina is very thankful for this loan, her third with Esperanza, and she hopes to continue her successful borrowing in the future. Thank you for lending to Gina and Las Escogidas Group!

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise and rice, bananas and juices

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady Kouyaté est mariée, elle a 3 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE PLACE GAO depuis 7 ans et y a bénéficié de 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans problèmes. Elle veut renforcer sa cantine qui se trouve au marché central de son quartier en marchandises. Les bénéfices escomptés lui permettront de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady Kouyaté is married and cares for three children. She has been a member of the village bank "Boucotte Place Gao" for seven years and got 14 loans which she repaid all without difficulty. She wants to stock up her canteen, which is located at the central market of her neighborhood. The expected profit will enable her to contribute to a higher standard of living for her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up her canteen

loans.name: Janepher Namutebi 's Group

texts.en: Janepher is 34 year married with four children aged between 6 and 12 .All her children go to school .She resides and rents a two roomed house where she stays with six people  The family has access to electricity and no piped water and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala. Janepher has a stall selling Newspapers in Makerere Kikoni and buys these news papers from distributors and so she doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from shopping.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business as she works from her home. Janepher sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale Janepher has been in this business for eight years and with MCDT for one year servicing her third loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy newspapers varieties and magazines. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a distributing van.

loans.use: To buy more newspapers and magazines

loans.name: Freddy Edgar

texts.en:
Freddy is a 40-year-old married father of two children. He has a farm where he grows crops as well as producing milk from his dairy cows. For eighteen years now he has been working on the farm, which is located in the town of Sorata, in the Vinto Province of Cochabamba Department. He has been working in agriculture since he was a child helping on his parents' farm.

Freddy plans on using the loan from CIDRE to buy fertilizer as well as seeds for growing potatoes, corn, and parsley. He begins his work before dawn each morning, because he needs to collect the parsley so it can be taken to be sold at the markets in town. This way, he can sell to customers who come to the market in the morning looking for fresh herbs.

Freddy hopes the loan will help him to increase his earnings so that he can build a better home for his family, as the one they live in now is simple and small. He also hopes to continue taking care of his elderly mother, whose health has been deteriorating. While Freddy never finished high school, he does not believe that has impeded the growth of his business. But more than anything, however, he wants to ensure he has enough money saved to fund the entire education of his two daughters.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah B. is married and has five children. She has no educational background. Hannah is a fishmonger. She goes to the sea, buys fish, smokes them, and then sells them at Elmina near Eselem.  This has been her business since 1984. Her husband is a fisherman.  Hannah uses her income to help pay the bills and the children's school fees. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to process by smoking and then resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase to more fish to sell.

loans.name: Omuka

texts.en: Omuka sells cloths and has been in this business for over 4 years, He is requesting for the loan amount of N70, 000 to purchase more cloths to sell. He is 34 years old and married with a child. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cloths to sell.

loans.name: The Lord Is The Owner Group

texts.en:
The Lord Is The Owner is a group of five borrowers led by Theresa D.. She is 56 years old and married with five children between the ages of 20 and 38. The children's educational levels are between 10th grade and university graduate. Theresa herself is illiterate due to poverty. Theresa and her family live in a newly built community located north of the capital, Monrovia, in Liberia. The homes are for poor people who can't afford to buy a lot in town.

Theresa's business is selling charcoal. She buys charcoal wholesale and resells it at retail prices to residents of Virginia, north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for six years and hopes to establish a general store in the future. Theresa sells quality charcoal and talks to her customers in a friendly way in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Theresa needs this loan in order to purchase more charcoal to fill her customers' needs. She dreams of educating her children and improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Las Canelitas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Canelitas” esta representado por la señora Zoila y conformado por 12 miembros muy unidos y activos, realizando confraternizaciones como celebrar cumpleaños D. alguna D. las socias para así  conocerse mas, también indicar que son muy ordenadas en sus reuniones que realizan. La señora Zoila  tiene como actividad la venta D. cosméticos, heladitos y hielo en su domicilio, El resto D. las socias se dedican a actividades como a la venta D. comida y a al realización D. empanada, costura y comercialización D. bolsones hechos a mano, zapatos, tostado y pastillas. La competencia hoy en día se ve más que en otros años pero lo importante es que ellas tienen clientes fijos y ellas siempre cumplen al pedido D. sus clientes, además tratan D. vender su producto a un menor precio minimizando sus costos y  generando una ganancia razonable para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del crédito es para la compra D. cosméticos en baratas, harina para hacer empanadas y al compra D. materiales e insumos para sus negocios D. comida, zapatos y ropa. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los socios ya tienen experiencia en grupos comunales gracias a créditos similares en otras instituciones por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo y saben como administrar bien los fondos otorgados.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Fata Ngouss Group

texts.fr: Nous groupement "Fata Ngouss" membres de l'écovillage de Palmarin(http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarin.php), venons solliciter auprès de kiva un prêt pour faire des activités d'embouche ovine . Avec le prêt,comme c'est la basse saison, nous souhaitons acheter des moutons à bas prix, les engraisser et les revendre surtout à l'occasion des fêtes de l'Aîd El Kabir, mais aussi à l'arrivée des pélerins venant de la Mecque.
texts.en:
We are the members of "Fata Ngouss Group" from the ecovillage of Palmarin and come to Kiva to apply for a loan to breed sheep. We want to use the loan to buy sheep at a low price, since we are now in the low season, and fatten them. We intend to sell them mainly for the festivities of Eid al-Kabir, but also when pilgrims return from Mecca.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To breed sheep

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is 42 years old and married with three children between the ages of 19 and 22. All her children go to school. She owns a seven-room house where she lives with five people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.

Flavia has a stall in Kalerwe where she sells bananas. She buys her bananas from delivery trucks that get them from neighboring villages, so she doesn’t incur extra transport costs. She doesn’t pay rent for her business but pays daily market dues. She also is required to have a Kawempe sub-county operating license. Flavia sells both retail and wholesale and to all categories of people.

She has been in this business for nine years and with MCDT for seven years, now servicing her seventeenth loan, and working with the same group mates. Flavia wants to use this loan to buy more bananas. She wants to see her business grow larger and would like to own a distribution van that she could use to get bananas directly from farmers.

loans.use: To buy more bananas

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward M. is married and has four children. He has received a junior high school education.  Edward is a seamstress and also sells sewing materials such as thread, needles, linings and so on at Castle near Yamoransah, which he has been doing since 2000. His wife is a trader.  Edward uses his income to pay school fees and to settle the utility bills.  Edward will use the loan to buy more sewing materials to sell and also for use in his sewing. Edward plans to invest his new profits back into his business.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials for his business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos V. G. es un señor de 39 años de edad. Vive en una casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijas. Su familia se ha dedicado desde hace muchos años a la ganadería tanto para leche como para carne. Él siguió los mismos pasos y actualmente tiene una finca que es la que le ayuda a salir adelante. 

La comunidad en la cual vive don Juan Carlos se llama El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba. Es una pequeña comunidad rural de unos dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano, sin embargo varias veces al año, el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que caen en la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en el Atlántico de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona.

Hace dos años, se instaló en la comunidad una planta de elaboración de quesos de la Asociación de Productores de Leche de El Sauce. Por lo tanto, en los últimos dos años don Juan Carlos ha ido especializándose en la producción de leche que luego vende a esta planta. 

Don Juan Carlos desea obtener un microcrédito por ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera más y así aumentar la producción de leche. El sabe que contar con una vaca más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo pero dice que si quiere sacar su familia adelante tiene que esforzarse en producir más.

Actualmente don Juan Carlos ordeña a mano en una pequeña instalación de madera que acondicionó como sala de ordeño. Dice que por día logra producir aproximadamente 40 litros de leche y con una vaca más su producción aumentaría a 60 litros diarios por lo cual esta muy emocionado de poder ver como su negocio crece y se fortalece.

Don Juan Carlos es cliente de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una organización local socia de la microfinanciera EDESA. Gracias a su vinculación con esta organización ha obtenido ya un  microcrédito y lo ha cancelado satisfactoriamente ayudándole a crecer en su negocio de producción de leche y sus derivados.

loans.use: Compra de una vaca lechera

loans.name: Okoro

texts.en: P. sells babythings; she has been in this business for years now. She is 35 years old and married with 2 children.  She is requesting for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more baby things to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more babythings to sell.

loans.name: Las Paraguayitas Group

texts.es:
This committee formed in the Emapalado Ari Neighborhood of the city of Caaguazú. Marta V. participated in a group of women that commissioned local women for promotion, and Fundación Paraguaya awarded small loans for women. They had much enthusiasm about it and decided to participate in the program, and they found 18 women to join. They invested in work that would increase their financial income. They have their own activities to sell such as clothes, shoes, fruits and vegetables, and more. Some took out loans of 800,000, others 500,000, and others 300,000 Gs. They are using their loans to buy sugar, meat, wheat, eggs, clothes, cheese, hens, and more from their loans awarded from Fundación Paraguaya. 
Marta V. V. wants to use her loan to sell fruits and vegetables. 
Benigna G. wants to use her loan for a chipera. 
María A. C. wants to use her loan to sell fruits and vegetables. 
Digna A. F. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Ceferina C. D. P. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Alodia V. C. wants to use her loan to sell fruits and vegetables. 
Alicia S. B. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Hortencia G. wants to use her loan for a small grocery store. 
María A. C. wants to uer her loan to sell fruits and vegetables. 
Ramona A. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Norma B. A. wants to use her loan to sell fruits and vegetables. 
Nidia A. C. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Nidia B. G. C. wants to use her loan to sell candy. 
B. J. A. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Ana K. C. wants to use her loan to sell undergarments. 
Ramona InsaurralD. wants to use her loan to be a hairdresser. 
Miguelina C. wants to use her loan for a small grocery store. 
Rosa G. InsaurralD. wants to use her loan for a small grocery store.

loans.use: Food, Clothes, etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 40 years old and married with four children between the ages of 19 and 26. Two of her children go to school, and the rest have completed their schooling. She owns a three-room house where she lives with six people. The family doesn’t have access to electricity or to piped water.

Joyce works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She has a stall in Kalerwe and sells sugar cane. She buys her sugar cane from faraway villages in Namataba, and so she pays transportation costs to and from her shopping. She doesn’t pay rent for her business, but she pays daily market dues. She also pays for a Kawempe sub-county operating license.

Joyce works seven days a week, selling both retail and wholesale to all categories of people. She has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for three years, now servicing her sixth loan and working with the same group mates. She would like to have a sugar cane farm. Joyce wants to see her business grow bigger and to own a van for getting sugar cane directly from the farmers.

loans.use: To buy more sugar cane to sell.

loans.name: Cariñositas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Cariñositas” están representados por la señora Mercedes y conformado por 15 miembros muy unido y activo, como lo demuestran en cada reunión, La presidenta tiene como actividad la venta de ropa en el mercado central y eñl resto de las socias se dedican a la venta de abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, venta de ropa, bisutería, promotora de cosméticos refrescos, atención en salones de belleza, y a la construcción de viviendas una mayoría de las socias son madres de familia. La competencia hoy en día se ve más que en otros años pero lo importante es que ellas tienen clientes fijos y ellas siempre cumplen al pedido de sus clientes, además tratan de vender su producto a un menor precio minimizando sus costos y  generando una ganancia razonable para el sustento de sus familias. El destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería como ropa de la temporada, pagos de deudas, compra de insumos y materiales y la adquisición de herramientas de trabajo. El destino del crédito es para la compra de cosméticos en baratas, harina para hacer empanadas y al compra de materiales e insumos para sus negocios de comida, zapatos y ropa. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los socios ya tienen experiencia en grupos comunales gracias a créditos similares en otras instituciones por lo que conocen la modalidad de trabajo y saben como administrar bien los fondos otorgados.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones
